title: Wanna be on French National TV :)
description:
Wanna be on French National TV :) in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 23, 2015, 12:00 AM (CEST). A friend of mine is looking for fellow Couch surfers for one of her projects that soon will be filmed by a team from French National TV. Here is her message for you guys! :)

"Are you in Paris from June 23-27? Do you want to be on TV?

I am a startup founder based in Toronto.  My startup connects you with locals who share your interests – like having a friend show you their home city. You can check out a one-minute video on Youtube here: http://bit.ly/1GfU3nf

I just learned that my startup might be featured on a prime-time TV show in France, with an average viewership of 4.5 million people. The show will be about new ways of travelling and they are interested in filming one our tours in action.  

If you will be in Paris during that period and are not camera shy, or know of someone else, please let JB know about it (preferably through PM).  The journalist has indicated that he would prefer to film a group (2-4 people is ideal) so that the group can interact.  Obviously the tour will be free.  I will be giving away 4 free tours (2 hours long) so that I can propose different date /time options.  

In your response please indicate:

1. Where you are from, a little bit about you
2. Who you are travelling with
3. What days you are in Paris
4. What specific date and time you would want the tour
5. If there's anything specific you would like to see during the tour

The show is documentary style so there is no acting involved. It would really be a fun, unique thing you can do while you're in Paris. "

title: Cheese and wine + artistic posing NUDIST Night!!!.
description:
Cheese and wine + artistic posing NUDIST Night!!!. in France at Jun 23, 2015,  7:30 PM (CEST). Hello!!! 

I'm going to La Ville Lumière next week and I'll be surfing with a naturist garçon over there ;) Well, I'm an artist and my host and I have decided to organize this artistic-nudist-bohemian event where, appart meeting people while having some french wine, those who would like to pose for me can do so!. Just think about it, perhaps in the future, one drawing of you could end up at the Louvre or the Pompidou Centre... haha, kiddin' ;) 

You can check out my work at this site so you can notice what kind of sketches to expect: lafabrica2d.wix.com/dosde 

Remember that it's a NUDIST event my friends ;) so, yeap!, only naked people will be aloud to get into it, locals and visitors are invited!. It will be good to have male and female participants, but not mandatory.
We are not going to get mad if you bring some wine or cheese too (just let's avoid meat products please). 

;) Come on!, how often you are in this kind of scenarios?, take this event as one of your genuine Paris souvenirs. 

À tout à l'heure!!!!!!.

* Directions will be sent by private message to participants ;)

title: Wednesday Picnic du Jour at Parc Monceau
start_at: Wed Jun 24 from  4:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Wed Jun 24 from  4:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
location: Parc Monceau, 35 Boulevard de Courcelles, 75008 Paris, France
description:
Wednesday Picnic du Jour at Parc Monceau in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 24, 2015,  4:00 PM (CEST). (May I suggest using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab)

_____________________________________________________________________________________

WEDNESDAY 'PICNIC du JOUR'

PARC MONCEAU

Wednesday's Picnic is in a lovely local parc with 'fairy-tale' motifs in the 8ème arrondisement. You will love the Parc Monceau!

Map where "X" marks the spot: http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Monceau.jpg

Google Map:
https://www.google.com/maps/@48.8794766,2.3087614,17z

Look for the 'Picnic du Jour' tri-couleur blanket: http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/PicnicColors.jpg

♫ ♫ ♫ ♫ Parc Monceau is a secure parc that closes environ de 20:30-21h. Everyone at the Picnic du Jour who is interested, should consider joining our very good friend, Manu later at his PICNIC BY THE CANAL w/Free Concerts: https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/picnic-by-the-canal-followed-by-free-concerts

_____________________________________________________

Come to the "Picnic du Jour", a daily 'non-touristic' picnic for everyone, in a different lovely location around Paris.
Arrive at any time you want to... Meet other CSers in Paris, make plans, have fun!

Bring VERRES en PLASTIQUE, WINE & Drinks, BAGUETTE, Serviettes, Apportez un tire-bouchon, and anything else that you want to eat and share. Be warm. 

Bring your music.

...à bientôt au Picnic du Jour!

▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄▄

TOMORROW, THURSDAY, JUNE 25:  https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/thursdau-picnic-du-jour-at-bassin-de-la-villette

The Thursday 'Picnic du Jour' is at Bassin de la Villette: www.eneurope.net/CSParis/PdJ/Jeudi.html

__________________________________________________

The weekly schedule for 2015 is always online at http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic_du_Jour/

The weekly schedule is also on the Picnic du Jour Group page at https://www.couchsurfing.com/groups/le-paris-picnic-du-jour.

Come to the 6th Anniversary "Picnic-du-Jour' Picnic at Parc de Sceaux on Sunday, July 26. https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/picnic-6th-anniversary-picnic-du-jour

(Working on a better way to do it: Take a look at Rodney's "GuestPlaces.net")

title: Picnic by the canal, followed by free concerts
start_at: Wed Jun 24 from  5:00 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Wed Jun 24 from  5:00 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Picnic by the canal, followed by free concerts in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 24, 2015,  5:00 PM (CEST). Hello picnic & music lovers! Want to relax by the canal then attend a free music festival? This event is for you! 

🍺 🍴 BRING BEERS, WINE, FOOD: IT'S A PICNIC! 

Plastic or (better) reusable cups are also pretty useful. Knives, corkscrews and perhaps disposable plates too.

For those you like craft beers, there's a place called "Les Enfants Gâtés" very close to the canal (on your way if you come from Gare de l'Est): https://goo.gl/maps/b1Ozw (open till 9)

Basically, just bring whatever food and drinks you like - it's a picnic, anything works!

►PICNIC SPOT:

If you don't know this beautiful place, it's opposite 110 quai de Jemmapes just in front of the Franprix (open till 8:45). Have a look at the map & check this photo of the picnic spot: http://www.flickr.com/photos/meteorry/3817229706/

Streetview: https://goo.gl/maps/X8QQo

♫ ♫ FREE CONCERTS:

At some point, probably around 8, we'll go to Place de la République to enjoy the free gigs: https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/free-concerts-place-de-la-republique Of course you can go earlier or stay longer, it's really up to you!



✪✪✪ Everyone's welcome to join, feel free to invite friends. Unicorns and fluffy toys can also join, especially if they have a CS profile. And so we can be easily spotted, I'll put a red blanket in front of us. Otherwise just ask or look for the nice group of people mixing French and English!

title: CS weekly meeting "russian-french"
start_at: Wed Jun 24 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Wed Jun 24 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
description:
CS weekly meeting "russian-french" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 24, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Vous savez que CHAQUE MERCREDI nous nous retrouvons vers 20 heures et pourquoi pas plus tôt aussi pour ceux qui veulent flâner !!! Si vous êtes russophone et voulez parler français ou inversement. Echanger des idées, partager des points de vue, parler de culture, demander des infos, de l'aide ou juste boire un verre. Rejoignez nous chaque mercredi au 9 rue des Boulangers près du métro Jussieu au Finnegans Wake.
Demandez au bar où l'on se trouve.
A bientôt !!! Франко-русская вечеринка в 2014 в Париже!!!
Сегодня, в среду , в 20 часов в Finneganns Wake.
Два зала в нашем распоряжении, музыка и танцы для всех, кто хочет расслабиться
Приносите игры, всё, чем желаете поделиться, книги, идеи и особенно ваше хорошее настроение!
Место: http://www.finneganswakeparis.com/
Адрес: улица des Boulangers, 9, напротив выхода из метро Jussieu.
Будем рады видеть новые лица и ваших друзей на каждой встрече. Белорусы, русские, украинцы и все, кто проездом в Париже, добро пожаловать !! До встречи.
Телефон для связи для новичков: +33 660 119 500
и ссылка на группу http://vk.com/club54479152

title: Montmartre Free Walking Tour
description:
Montmartre Free Walking Tour in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 25, 2015,  8:00 AM (CEST). Worldwide known for its rich history, beauty, culture, architecture, museums, cuisine, art, Paris offers unlimted opportunities to enrich your travel experience. I took bits of all of that and prepared for you free walking tours.

Quick overview:

Hidden in the North of Paris, Montmartre joined the city year 1860 and became the place for bohemians, artists and courtisans including Van Gogh, Picasso, Renoir, Degas…

Visit our page, choose your day, book a slot and join us at: https://www.triip.me/paris/montmartre-free-tour-6081/

title: Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers'
start_at: Thu Jun 25 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jun 25 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers' in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 25, 2015,  6:00 PM (CEST). --*Museum "Arts & Metiers" :

Free: at 6pm till 9:30pm

*On the subway, the atmosphere is there … the station Arts & Métiers papered with copper and drilled by porthole, takes itself for the submarine Nautilus of Jules Verne.
In the religiously renewed abbey, the history techniques for the XVIth century follows seven domain: communication, construction, energy, instruments scientists, materials, mechanics, transport.
We can so understand everything big inventions and to dream in front of automatons and velocipedes, about the end of XVIIth century laboratory of Lavoisier or Clément Ader's plane...
-
*Dès le métro, l’ambiance est là… La station Arts & Métiers tapissée de cuivre et percée de hublot, se prend pour le sous-marin Nautilus de Jules Verne.
Dans l’abbaye religieusement rénovée, l’histoire des techniques depuis le XVIe siècle suit sept domaine: communication, construction, énergie, instruments scientifiques, matériaux, mécanique, transport.
On peut ainsi tout comprendre des grandes inventions et rêver devant les automates et les vélocipèdes, le laboratoire fin XVIIe de Lavoisier ou l’avion de Clément Ader, vieux d’un petit siècle de plus...

Address: 60, Rue Réaumur
Subway: Arts-et-Métiers (line 3 & 11)
---

end_at: Thu Jun 25 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Conversation Table: Convertable in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 25, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). This group intends to bring together anglophones and francophones in order to create the opportunity for everyone to have conversations.  Anyone interested in languages and/or learning French or English is welcome. 
If you're the first to arrive, ask a table to the bar and tell them you're here for the Conversation table; be patient, people will arrive. 
 
 Le but de ce groupe est de rassembler les anglophones et francophones afin d'établir un commerce de langues: Toute personne intéressée par les langues et/ou qui souhaite perfectionner son anglais ou français est la bienvenue.
Si vous êtes le premier à arriver, demandez une table au bar et précisez que vous venez pour la Table de Conversation. Soyez patient, il y aura du monde.

title: Open mic & jam every thursday
location: Le Carre Saint Michel, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Open mic & jam every thursday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 25, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). I've been organizing those events weekly for the past 3 years with my talented singers and musicians friends that I have met on different concerts and TV shows in my 15 years in Paris, so you can hear some pretty cool artists and it's very nice to come and listen, or even play if you feel like it :) As I host a lot of couchsurfers and also post the event there and on Meetup, the atmosphere is quite international too with a pre-meeting with international travellers & expats from 8.30 to 9.30 before the music starts so people can get to know each other.

The drinks are pretty cheap compared to Paris prices, with happy hour prices all evening. And the bar is very central and easy to find, right by the métro exit in Saint-Michel. When the crowd is wild and we wanna keep playing, we actually often continue the jam by the river after 2 am.

The music usually starts around 9.30 but the Meeting starts at 8.30 so we can have time for drinks and get to know each other before I have to open the live session. You can find me easily (behind the sound counsol) if you arrive late though and I can point you to the Couchsurfers group.

The type of music depends on the performers who will show up. It's mostly pop, folk, rock, blues, soul, sometimes reggae, world music or rap. A little jazz sometimes, but it's mostly mainstream music.

All the sound system is in place and you can also borrow my electro acoustic guitar if you need, but it's still better to bring your own instrument if it can be plugged.

To ensure the quality of the performances for the audience, the first time performers should send me a link to one of their work or live videos, or you will have to play when the room is less crowded so I can know if I can release you in the wild jungle of a crowded audience later :)

▄▄▄ ★ INFO ★ ▄▄▄

Bar : Le Carré Saint michel Address : 4, Rue Suger, 75006 Metro-RER : Saint Michel (line 4 - RER B). The rue Suger is facing the métro exit "place Saint-André-des-Arts" so it's very easy to find. If you get off at any other exit, then you have to go right on the Saint-Michel fountain and you'll be on place Saint-André-des-Arts. From the place, 2 streets go right, the rue Suger is the second one.

▄▄▄ ★ PRICES ★ ▄▄▄

It's cover free but the bar owner won't be happy if you don't get at least one drink to help out the bar and the artists ;) The prices are cheaper than most places in Paris :

✪ Various shots : 3,5 € ✪ Glasses of wine : 4 € ✪ Beer Pints : 4.5 € ✪ Cocktails : 6 €

-----------------------------------

RDV à partir de 20h30 au Carré Saint-Michel pour l'Open Mic & Jam du jeudi ! Un niveau correct est requis pour chanter 2 à 3 chansons ou pour jammer avec les habitués du Carré pour garantir un show de qualité au public. Les musiciens et chanteurs habitués sont issus des meilleures rencontres musicales que j'ai pu faire lors de mes 14 ans de musique à Paris, dans divers concerts ou même quelques émissions de TV comme Nouvelle Star, The Voice, X-Factor ou Popstars donc il y a pas mal de voix étonnantes :)

description:
Friday Picnic-du-Jour in Paris, France at Jun 26, 2015,  4:00 PM (CEST). (May I suggest using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab)

_____________________________________________________________________________________

FRIDAY 'PICNIC du JOUR'

les ARÈNES de LUTÈCE & QUAI de la TOURNELLE

Friday's Picnic begins at the ancient Roman Arena, and continues later when we take a walk to the Quai de la Tournelle, on the Seine opposit the magnificent Notre Dame!

Map where "X" marks the spot at les Arènes: http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Lutece.jpg

Google Map for les Arènes:
https://www.google.com/maps/@48.8451866,2.3531267,17z

Map where "X" marks the spot at Tournelle: http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Tournelle.jpg

Google Map for Tournelle:
https://www.google.com/maps/@48.8504204,2.3535455,17z

Come to the "Picnic du Jour", a daily 'non-touristic' picnic for everyone, in a different lovely location around Paris.
Arrive at any time you want to... Meet other CSers in Paris, make plans, have fun!

Bring VERRES en PLASTIQUE, WINE & Drinks, BAGUETTE, Water, Serviettes, Apportez un tire-bouchon, and anything else that you want to eat and share. Be warm. Bring your music.

...à bientôt au Picnic du Jour!

title: Salad, Finger food Pic-Nic
start_at: Fri Jun 26 from  7:00 PM to 11:50 PM (CEST)
end_at: Fri Jun 26 from  7:00 PM to 11:50 PM (CEST)
description:
Salad, Finger food Pic-Nic in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 26, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). Hi finger food, salads lovers !

Let's do a sunny pic-nic near Montmartre (Sacré-Coeur) at the park ;-)

I'll bring some (but only some) of the Moscatel we drunk last pic-nic, a Spanish sweet beverage.

Theme is Finger food and tapas. Everyone bring home made (or park made) food ;-)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finger_food

No snacks please :-)

Métro : Near Château-Rouge metro station line 4 and Anvers line 2 .

Location : Come to Muller's street, and follow it up, then get in the park of Montmartre, we'll be on the way of the left path.

Map : https://www.google.fr/maps/dir/Ch%C3%A2teau+Rouge,+Paris/48.8860196,2.3450088/@48.8856044,2.3436751,17z/data=!4m14!4m13!1m10!1m1!1s0x47e66e67ce836379:0x72aed4ba8ed9f6f6!2m2!1d2.349457!2d48.887159!3m4!1m2!1d2.3457311!2d48.8865337!3s0x47e66e5d4b798f55:0x991860ffbf97529c!1m0!3e2

It's easy to find us, there will be a large ORANGE blanket on the grass and nice CSers on it :-)

There is supermarket nearby, have a look on the map, at 17 Rue de Clignancourt there is a Carrefour supermarket. And near the metro station there is one at 68 Boulevard Barbes.

The weather should be perfect, but in case it isn't I offer to the travelers to come to my place very near, instead of leaving them in rainy Paris' street.

I'll bring disposable knives as well to prepare your super food, and disposable plates for eatting.

See you, Eddy

title: Café-Anglais pour tous n°55
start_at: Sat Jun 27 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jun 27 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Café-Anglais pour tous n°55   in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 27, 2015,  4:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Le Café-Anglais consiste à discuter informellement in English
 autour d'un verre (and 50% in French si des natifs y participent).

Chacun arrive à l'heure qui l'arrange.

 *-* Tous les niveaux sont admis *-*

Nous constituons des groupes au hasard, et nous switchons de groupe au bout d'un certain temps afin de
pouvoir discuter avec un max de personnes.

It's more beneficial if people correct each other's mistake, identify desuetude words etc.

NB : afin de pouvoir continuer à nous rendre dans des bars qui se prêtent aux discussions en anglais, je vous remercie de bien vouloir passer au moins une commande ;-)

PS : dictionary is recommended :-)

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 Dear CouchSurfing members,

 I propose you to discuss informally, half in English and half in French if Natives.

 You can arrive when it suits you.

 *-* all levels are welcome *-*

 Groups are made randomly & we switch in order to discuss with a max of people.

 NB : to be able to continue to meet in proper bars, I thank you in advance to order at least one time ;-)

title: Club Photo CS Paris
description:
Club Photo CS Paris in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 27, 2015, 10:00 PM (CEST). Bonjour à toutes et à tous,

Alors, cette semaine je vous propose de nous retrouver pour une sortie nocturne autour des ponts et de la vie urbaine de Paris.

Ca sera l'occasion de tester de nouvelles techniques ( jeu de lumières )et de nouveaux matériels ( trépieds ). J'invite donc tout ceux qui auraient des trépieds à les apporter si c'est possible. 

Nous nous retrouverons sur Le Pont Notre Dame ( Métro 1  Hotel de Ville, 4 St Michel/ Cité, 10 Maubert Mutualité/ Cluny Sorbonne)  pour débuter la séance et ensuite nous déambuleront dans les quartiers les plus intéressants. 

Cette invitation reste ouverte, gratuite et libre. 

Pour me contacter voici mon numéro (whatsapp) : 07 83 75 47 29

A très bientôt. 

PS: Pour découvrir les photos prises par les membres du groupe, au Parc Monceau,  la semaine dernière, je vous invite à aller sur la page FB de " Club de Fotografia CS " dont voici le lien : 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/CSFOTO/?fref=ts

Hi everyone, 

This week I invite you to meet us for a 
night out around the bridges and the city life of Paris. 
It will be an occasion to test new techniques ( lighting effect) and new equipments ( tripod ). So I invite all people who have tripods to bring it if it possible. 
 
We'll start from " Le Pont Notre Dame "( Métro 1  Hotel de Ville, 4 St Michel/ Cité, 10 Maubert Mutualité/ Cluny Sorbonne) and then we'll walk about the most interesting areas. 

This invitation is open and free. 

To join me, my contact Whatsapp: 
07 83 75 47 29

Hope to see you.

title: Cruise on the Marne + Nature reserve of Pâtis
start_at: Sun Jun 28 from  9:15 AM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jun 28 from  9:15 AM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Cruise on the Marne + Nature reserve of Pâtis in France at Jun 28, 2015,  9:15 AM (CEST). ENGLISH BELOW

Une escapade sur les bords de la Marne avec croisière et randonnée dans un parc naturel. Programme de la journée :

09h31 : départ de la Gare de l’Est en Transilien P

09h55 : arrivée à la gare de Lagny-Thorigny, marche jusqu’à l’embarcadère de Dampmart

11h : croisière sur la Marne (participation 1 euro)

Vers 12h : pique-nique partagé (merci d’apporter à manger et à boire)

12h55 ou 13h25 : départ de la gare de Lagny-Thorigny pour Meaux

13h10 ou 13h40 : arrivée à Meaux. Randonnée au Parc naturel de Pâtis. Étalé sur 150 hectares, le parc présente une grande diversité de paysages (étangs, bords de Marne, prairies fleuries, grande roselière, espaces boisés) et abrite pas moins de 70 espèces d’oiseaux.

Vers 17h : départ pour Paris.

À savoir :

1) Si vous avez un passe Navigo mensuel ou annuel, vous profitez du « dézonage », le coût des déplacements est donc nul. Si vous n’avez pas de passe Navigo, prévoir 17,35 euros pour les trois tickets dont vous aurez besoin.

2) S’il fait vraiment mauvais, on annulera la randonnée.

3) Le rendez-vous est près du guichet « Vente Ile-de-France » à la Gare de l’Est. Quand vous sortez de la gare en suivant les panneaux « Accès aux trains / Trains Ile-de-France », vous sortez vers les quais. Le guichet « Vente Ile-de-France » se trouve en face, près des quais. (Voir http://i.imgur.com/2dt61n8.jpg) Je serai là entre 09h15 et 09h25, merci de venir avant 09h25. À 09h25 nous nous dirigerons vers le train et monterons dedans.

_________________________________________________________________________

A one-day getaway from Paris to the banks of the Marne and a hike in a nature reserve. Programme of the day:

09.31 a.m.: departure from Gare de l’Est by train Transilien line P

09.55 a.m.: arrival at Lagny-Thorigny station, walk until the pier of Dampmart

11 a.m.: cruise on the Marne river (costs 1 euro)

Around midday : shared picnic (please bring some snacks and a drink of your choice)

12.55 or 01.25 p.m.: departure from Lagny-Thorigny station for Meaux

01.10 or 01.40 p.m.: arrival to Meaux. Hike in the nature reserve of Pâtis.
Taking 150 hectares, the park presents a great diversity of landscapes (ponds, banks of the Marne river, flowered meadows, a reed bed, woods) and is home to not less than 70 bird species.

Around 5 p.m.: departure for Paris

Good to know :

1) If you have a monthly or annual Navigo transport card, whatever zones you have with your subscription, the card covers all zones on weekends. If you don’t, the three paper tickets you will need will cost 17,35 euros.

2) If the weather gets really poor, the hike will be cancelled.

3) The meeting point is near the ticket booth “Vente Ile-de-France” at Gare de l’Est train station. When you walk out of the station, follow the signs “Accès aux trains / Trains Ile-de-France”, and you will reach the platforms. The ticket booth “Vente Ile-de-France” is just in front, near the platforms. (See http://i.imgur.com/2dt61n8.jpg) I will be there between 09.15 and 09.25 a.m., please come before 09.25. At 09.25 we will leave the meeting point to take the train.

description:
Sunday Morning Outdoor Market in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 28, 2015, 10:00 AM (CEST). May I suggest using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Be prepared to be tempted by the most beautiful and abundant fruits and vegetables, by wine-sellers, mushrooms, herbs, so much pastry and bread, fresh poultry and meats, and bright-eyed fishes! Don't be surprised to discover that you will want to buy it all!

____________
PARIS SUNDAY MORNING MARKET____________

SUNDAY/DIMANCHE ~ June 28 ~ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-outdoor-market-paris
SUNDAY/DIMANCHE ~ July 5 ~ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-outdoor-market-paris-2015-07-05
PARIS RENDEZ VOUS ~ July 19 - https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-street-markets-prv-2015

Wake up on Sunday morning to join Parisians at the outdoor markets of "Ricard Lenoir" and "Place d'Aligre"

First -
Richard Lenoir Sunday Morning Market
A pleasure for Parisians and CS visitors to Paris
Enjoy one of our city's fantastic weekly outdoor markets in the company of your Couchsurfing Friends!

From there, we shall enjoy a walk past the Place de la Bastille and on to the Place d'Aligre Market

_____________________________________________________________

Arrive hungry. There is a tempting variety of delicious street food available at the markets. You will want to taste some of it.

____________________________________________________________

Take Metro Line 5 to "Bréguet Sabin"

Meeting at the "Bréguet Sabin" Metro exit (Line 5)
Leave the Metro by Sortie #1 to rue Saint-Sabin, the north stairway furthest from Place de la Bastille.


Detail Map where "X" marks the spot : www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Lenoir.jpg

Google Map to Place de la Bastille: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Place+de+la+Bastille/@48.852477,2.3677117,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x47e67201aca99229:0x231eb0c967e5eb10

___________________________________________________


* NOTE THE WEATHER:
THERE IS ALWAYS A POSSIBILITY OF RAIN.
If it is raining, we will still have this event. Rain is nothing unusual at a Paris public market. There is some protection under awnings and pavillons, but be warm and dry.
In case of rain, BRING YOUR UMBRELLA/EMPORTEZ VOTRE PARAPLUIE.

description:

Retour de Gilles Peterson à Paris pour un nouvel épisode de la TEA-TIME, son unique résidence française !

title: one man show "Le tour du monde en 180 vannes"
start_at: Mon Jun 29 from  7:45 PM to  9:15 PM (CEST)
end_at: Mon Jun 29 from  7:45 PM to  9:15 PM (CEST)
description:
one man show "Le tour du monde en 180 vannes" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 29, 2015,  7:45 PM (CEST). Quand un humoriste vous raconte son tour du monde à l'arrache…ça donne le seul one man show qui vous fait cumuler des smiles! :)
Je suis parti faire le tour du monde pendant 15 mois; c'est ce que je raconte avec audace, impertinence et énergie dans ce spectacle original, espiègle et surtout très drôle, Je vous fait voyager des bus bondés d'Afrique aux clubs de zouk chinois, de Porto-Rico au Japon, des nuits chaudes d'Amérique latine aux compagnies aériennes rasta des Caraïbes. N'oubliez pas votre passeport et votre maillot de bain! :)
Beaucoup de gens, parmi lesquels de nombreux CSers, sont déjas venus voir mon one man show, que je joue depuis dec 2013. Tous ont été ravis. Plus d'infos ici: http://www.billetreduc.com/133812/evt.htm
Pour ma représentation parisienne de la saison, le lundi 29 juin à 20h, je propose aux CSers de venir assister au spectacle pour seulement 6€, soit le tiers du tarif normal! Ce tarif est valable aussi pour ceux qui vous accompagneront, même s'ils ne sont pas sur CS. Pensez à réserver vos places en vous inscrivant à l'événement CS (places limitées!) puis donner votre nom en arrivant au théâtre. Vous paierez sur place. Une occasion à ne pas rater!
On essayera d'aller boire un verre juste après le show pour ceux qui veulent. 
Désolé de ne pas pouvoir filer des invitations, mais je dois payer la salle et le régisseur.
Si certains veulent voir le spectacle mais ne seront pas dispo le 29 juin, envoyez moi un MP pour venir le 22 juin à 20h.

A bientôt j'espère!

title: Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub!
description:
Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub! in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 29, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello all travelers and Paris CSers,

The Quiz is our Monday weekly event even if playing the Quiz is optional. If you don't feel like playing, come and share a drink :)

Winners of the quiz get a bottle of vodka iwth juice and for the 2nd & 3rd place a round of shots!

If you are wondering who are the CSers ask to the bar staff, but you can just talk to someone, he or she'll usually be a CSer (at a certain time it is packed of CSers so just talk to someone randomly)

Even if the bar seems empty go inside and ask, at the end we're always 150 or more.

CS Paris has put together a weekly meet-up on Mondays nights for all it's Paris hosts, travelers, and their friends!

There will be cheap drinks, good food, and of course fabulous company.

Whether you're passing through Paris, just signed up to Couchsurfing, or are an old time CSer come join us for a night out on the town!

See you there!

WHEN ? EVERY monday from 8 pm The quiz starts at around 9 pm

WHERE ? The Lions Pub 153 rue du Chevaleret. 75013 Paris.

Metro 6 - Chevaleret or Metro 14, RER C - Bibliothèque François Mitterrand

HOW ? Stands ALL NIGHT - Kronenbourg Pint is 4€ - ALL other Pints 5€ - Mojito 5€ - the quizzmaster will get 2 free drinks and a Lions plate - Nachos plate : 5 € - Lions Plate (calamar, onion rings, chicken, french fries) : 10 €

PS: Since we are always a lot of people, remember to keep an eye on your stuff during the quiz!

title: Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi)
start_at: Tue Jun 30 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jun 30 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
location: L'atelier, Avenue Bernard Hirsch, Cergy, France
description:
Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi) in Cergy, Île-de-France, France at Jun 30, 2015,  6:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Nous vous proposons tous les mardis de participer à une réunion polyglot, de 18h30 à 21h00, au café "l'Atelier" (en face l'Essec et du parking de la Préfecture).
Nous nous retrouvons autour d'un verre, pour parler des langues qui ne nous sont pas maternelles.
Les langues pratiquées les plus souvent sont anglais, espagnol, allemand et français (langue étrangère), mais toutes les langues sont les bienvenues !

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hello,

We offer every Tuesday to attend a polyglot meeting, from 18:30 to 21:00 at the café "l'Atelier" (opposite ESSEC and parking of the Prefecture).
We meet for a drink, to speak foreign languages.
Usually, we speak English, Spanish, German and French, but all languages ​​are welcome!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hallo

wir bieten Euch an, dienstags am Polyglot-Treffen von 18:30 bis 21 Uhr im Café "L'Atelier" (gegenüber der Essec und dem Parkplatz der Präfektur) teilzunehmen.
Wir treffen uns dort auf ein Getränk um andere Sprachen zu sprechen als unsere Muttersprache. Die meist gesprochenen Sprachen sind Englisch, Spanisch, Deutsch und Französisch (als Fremdsprache), aber alle Sprachen sind willkommen!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
¡Hola a todos!

Los invitamos a participar en una reunión políglota, de 18h30 a 21h00, en el café L'Atélier (Frente a L'Essec y el parqueadero de la Prefectura).
Nosotros nos reunimos al calor de una bebida para conversar y practicar lenguas diferentes a la materna.
las lenguas más frecuentes en el grupo son el Inglés, el Español, el Alemán y el Francés (como lengua extranjera) ¡pero todas las idiomas son bienvenidas!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Cédric, Meike et Vincent
--- --- --- --- --- ---

Adresse :
Avenue Bernard Hirsch
95000 Cergy
-------------------------------
Activité présente sur :
Polyglot Club
http://www.polyglot-learn-language.com/meetings.php?post_id=1715

Facebook
http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/group.php?v=info&gid=288566448033

title: Cinema Club
description:
Cinema Club in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 30, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). Cinema Club is a loose collection of French, Ex-pats and travellers from Couchsurfing who head off to the cinema each week on a Tuesday night. We see a wide variety of film, from old black and white classics, to cult hits, or modern alternative films. We choose a different cinema each week and a different style, but one thing remains, we do this, and have done this, every week since June 2011. If you're a traveller don't worry, we always watch English language films, and if you're french, don't worry, they always have subtitles. After the film we usually hang around and take a beer at a bar or along the Seine if the weather is nice and talk about the film, cheese, the finer things in life or whatever might float our way. Come along and enjoy good cinema and good company. 

Details of this week's film will be online by the SUNDAY before the event. 

---Paris Cinéma Club---
So an Argentinian, an Australian and a Frenchman walk into a cinema… Every week night since June 2011, a different cinema, a different film, a cinematic experience and a beer. Viva la Paris.

title: Échange espagnol / français / pétanque
start_at: Tue Jun 30 from  7:30 PM to 10:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jun 30 from  7:30 PM to 10:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Échange espagnol / français / pétanque in Paris, France at Jun 30, 2015,  7:30 PM (CEST). ==ES==

Bienvenido al intercambio mas divertido de Paris!!!

Sin conversaciones forzadas ni gente hablado de manera no natural.

Concepto :
Traiga algo para comer y beber (para compartir en el picnic) y sus bolas de petanca, si tiene (yo ya tengo 6, que es suficiente para jugar)

Estaremos en la Esplanada des Invalides, en el cesped cercano la tierra para jugar petanca (ver la foto) (a 2 minutos del metro Invalides)

Punto de encuentro en la salida del metro Invalides a las 19h30, si no en el cesped cercano. 

Nos vemos!!!

PS: Telefono sera enviado por MP.

*Te invitamos a unirte a nuestro grupo fcbk "El aperitivo de Belleville".

** Anulado en caso de lluvia **

==FR==

Bienvenue à l'échange de langues le plus sympa de Paris!

Pas de table et séance des gens qui parlent d'une façon non naturelle.
Voici le concept :

Amenez quelque chose à boire et à manger, pour le pique-nique, et vos boules de pétanque, si vous avez (j'ai 6 déjà)

Nous partagerons un pique-nique et nous jouerons à la pétanque (pour les plus courageux): On boit un verre, on mange et rapidement vous allez vous sentir à l'aise.

Nous serons à l'esplanade des Invalides, dans la pelouse à côté de la terre (photo).

Rien de mieux pour apprendre le français ou l'espagnol!!!!
Nous espérons vous voir bientôt!

RDV sortie métro à 19h30 et dans la pelouse plus tard

PS: numéro mobile par MP.
* je vous invite à nous rejoindre sur fcbk, groupe "El aperitivo de Belleville".

** Sortie annulée en cas pluie **


=========

Lieu / Lugar Picnic :

Esplanade des Invalides
75007 Paris
Métro Invalides
Paris 7ème

title: El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol)
start_at: Tue Jun 30 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jun 30 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
location: 44 Boulevard de la Villette, París, Francia
description:
El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol) in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 30, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello everybody!!

We are happy to inform you that the nicest exchange of languages in Paris is coming back! Nothing about a table and people sitting speaking in an antinatural way, this is the concept:

Bring some food (For the first time you can bring chips or similar, experts users event cook at home :) We will share an aperitivo in the spanish way, drinking something, eating and making you feeling like you are part of our family. This is the best way to learn french or spanish, but if you want to speak english or even italian no problem, we are able to do it as well. Cheers and see you soon in El Aperitivo du Café Chéri (Facebook Group "El aperitivo de Belleville" for more events).

title: ☮☮☮ Tuesday Weekly Meeting #66 ☮☮☮
description:
☮☮☮ Tuesday Weekly Meeting #66 ☮☮☮ in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jun 30, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). The Event could be replaced by a CS Picnic if the weather is cool, news given 2/3 days in advance for the change of location (Depending of the Weather forecast)

❀❀❀ Hello Happy CouchSurfers ! ❀❀❀

◆ Get the latest details and pictures of the events here ◆

☞ https://www.facebook.com/groups/375285932624076/ ☜

❖ Join the event on CS if you are coming ❖

☞ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/tuesday-weekly-meeting-64 ☜

✪✪✪ This is our alternative meeting for people like us who are looking for a chilled out weekly event in Paris, like you get in smaller cities ✪✪✪

☮ It's very much about the CouchSurfing spirit: being open to friendship and mutual trust, respect and exchange with people from other cultures and ways of life ☮

❀ Everyone sharing that spirit -solo travelers passing by, newbies and experienced CouchSurfers or locals wishing to meet new people- is welcome ! ❀

☆☆☆ So there will be no binge drinking☢, party rocking☣ or ♥girl picking♥ here ;-p ☆☆☆

۩۩۩ We found a bar with an international & traveler soul, the Belushi's, really near Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est train stations, so it will be easy for you to join us ! ۩۩۩

↓↓↓There you will get↓↓↓

① a warm welcome and a cool name tag from the awesome organizers ! ☺

② drink and food deals (special deals for CouchSurfers) ♨

③ lots of space & TVs

④ free WiFi to send friend requests to the nice people you'll meet !

⑤ available electrical plugs

⑥ cool conversations & socializing with open-minded people like yourself ! ☮

⑦ and free pool games ! ❽❽❽

We'll book a dedicated area with large tables where you can sit, relax and meet great people !

☆☆☆ So welcome aboard and come share your CouchSurfing stories and travel experiences with us ! And if you don't know yet what CouchSurfing is about or how it works, come and learn all about it through everyone's amazing experiences ! ☆☆☆

The limit is just a guide, you can still show up if it has reached the limit, keeping in mind that the goal is that it remains intimate so you can all get to know each other !

→→→ So join us here every Tuesday night ←←←

Belushi's

5 rue de Dunkerque

75010 Paris

Gare du Nord: M4/5 & RER B/D and suburban trains

Gare de l'Est: M4/5/7 and suburban trains

How to get there: http://goo.gl/maps/tw2Bd

The entrance: http://goo.gl/maps/nJvKX

✪✪✪ Go to the left end of the bar, walk up the stairs and look for the CS signs around the pool table! We'll be waiting for you and looking forward to meeting all of you ! ✪✪✪

✌✌✌ See you soon! ✌✌✌

Ethan Savoie & Jed

CS Paris

title: Tonight I'm in Duplex
description:

end_at: Wed Jul 1 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
description:
CS weekly meeting "russian-french" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 01, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Vous savez que CHAQUE MERCREDI nous nous retrouvons vers 20 heures et pourquoi pas plus tôt aussi pour ceux qui veulent flâner !!! Si vous êtes russophone et voulez parler français ou inversement. Echanger des idées, partager des points de vue, parler de culture, demander des infos, de l'aide ou juste boire un verre. Rejoignez nous chaque mercredi au 9 rue des Boulangers près du métro Jussieu au Finnegans Wake.
Demandez au bar où l'on se trouve.
A bientôt !!! Франко-русская вечеринка в 2014 в Париже!!!
Сегодня, в среду , в 20 часов в Finneganns Wake.
Два зала в нашем распоряжении, музыка и танцы для всех, кто хочет расслабиться
Приносите игры, всё, чем желаете поделиться, книги, идеи и особенно ваше хорошее настроение!
Место: http://www.finneganswakeparis.com/
Адрес: улица des Boulangers, 9, напротив выхода из метро Jussieu.
Будем рады видеть новые лица и ваших друзей на каждой встрече. Белорусы, русские, украинцы и все, кто проездом в Париже, добро пожаловать !! До встречи.
Телефон для связи для новичков: +33 660 119 500
и ссылка на группу http://vk.com/club54479152

title: Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers'
start_at: Thu Jul 2 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 2 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers' in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 02, 2015,  6:00 PM (CEST). --*Museum "Arts & Metiers" :

Free: at 6pm till 9:30pm

*On the subway, the atmosphere is there … the station Arts & Métiers papered with copper and drilled by porthole, takes itself for the submarine Nautilus of Jules Verne.
In the religiously renewed abbey, the history techniques for the XVIth century follows seven domain: communication, construction, energy, instruments scientists, materials, mechanics, transport.
We can so understand everything big inventions and to dream in front of automatons and velocipedes, about the end of XVIIth century laboratory of Lavoisier or Clément Ader's plane...
-
*Dès le métro, l’ambiance est là… La station Arts & Métiers tapissée de cuivre et percée de hublot, se prend pour le sous-marin Nautilus de Jules Verne.
Dans l’abbaye religieusement rénovée, l’histoire des techniques depuis le XVIe siècle suit sept domaine: communication, construction, énergie, instruments scientifiques, matériaux, mécanique, transport.
On peut ainsi tout comprendre des grandes inventions et rêver devant les automates et les vélocipèdes, le laboratoire fin XVIIe de Lavoisier ou l’avion de Clément Ader, vieux d’un petit siècle de plus...

Address: 60, Rue Réaumur
Subway: Arts-et-Métiers (line 3 & 11)
---

start_at: Thu Jul 2 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 2 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Conversation Table: Convertable in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 02, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). This group intends to bring together anglophones and francophones in order to create the opportunity for everyone to have conversations.  Anyone interested in languages and/or learning French or English is welcome. 
If you're the first to arrive, ask a table to the bar and tell them you're here for the Conversation table; be patient, people will arrive. 
 
 Le but de ce groupe est de rassembler les anglophones et francophones afin d'établir un commerce de langues: Toute personne intéressée par les langues et/ou qui souhaite perfectionner son anglais ou français est la bienvenue.
Si vous êtes le premier à arriver, demandez une table au bar et précisez que vous venez pour la Table de Conversation. Soyez patient, il y aura du monde.

title: Open mic & jam every thursday
location: Le Carre Saint Michel, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Open mic & jam every thursday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 02, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). I've been organizing those events weekly for the past 3 years with my talented singers and musicians friends that I have met on different concerts and TV shows in my 15 years in Paris, so you can hear some pretty cool artists and it's very nice to come and listen, or even play if you feel like it :) As I host a lot of couchsurfers and also post the event there and on Meetup, the atmosphere is quite international too with a pre-meeting with international travellers & expats from 8.30 to 9.30 before the music starts so people can get to know each other.

The drinks are pretty cheap compared to Paris prices, with happy hour prices all evening. And the bar is very central and easy to find, right by the métro exit in Saint-Michel. When the crowd is wild and we wanna keep playing, we actually often continue the jam by the river after 2 am.

The music usually starts around 9.30 but the Meeting starts at 8.30 so we can have time for drinks and get to know each other before I have to open the live session. You can find me easily (behind the sound counsol) if you arrive late though and I can point you to the Couchsurfers group.

The type of music depends on the performers who will show up. It's mostly pop, folk, rock, blues, soul, sometimes reggae, world music or rap. A little jazz sometimes, but it's mostly mainstream music.

All the sound system is in place and you can also borrow my electro acoustic guitar if you need, but it's still better to bring your own instrument if it can be plugged.

To ensure the quality of the performances for the audience, the first time performers should send me a link to one of their work or live videos, or you will have to play when the room is less crowded so I can know if I can release you in the wild jungle of a crowded audience later :)

▄▄▄ ★ INFO ★ ▄▄▄

Bar : Le Carré Saint michel Address : 4, Rue Suger, 75006 Metro-RER : Saint Michel (line 4 - RER B). The rue Suger is facing the métro exit "place Saint-André-des-Arts" so it's very easy to find. If you get off at any other exit, then you have to go right on the Saint-Michel fountain and you'll be on place Saint-André-des-Arts. From the place, 2 streets go right, the rue Suger is the second one.

▄▄▄ ★ PRICES ★ ▄▄▄

It's cover free but the bar owner won't be happy if you don't get at least one drink to help out the bar and the artists ;) The prices are cheaper than most places in Paris :

✪ Various shots : 3,5 € ✪ Glasses of wine : 4 € ✪ Beer Pints : 4.5 € ✪ Cocktails : 6 €

-----------------------------------

RDV à partir de 20h30 au Carré Saint-Michel pour l'Open Mic & Jam du jeudi ! Un niveau correct est requis pour chanter 2 à 3 chansons ou pour jammer avec les habitués du Carré pour garantir un show de qualité au public. Les musiciens et chanteurs habitués sont issus des meilleures rencontres musicales que j'ai pu faire lors de mes 14 ans de musique à Paris, dans divers concerts ou même quelques émissions de TV comme Nouvelle Star, The Voice, X-Factor ou Popstars donc il y a pas mal de voix étonnantes :)

title: FRIDAY COUCHSURFING LANGUAGES
start_at: Fri Jul 3 from  7:30 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Fri Jul 3 from  7:30 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
location: The Long Hop, (Pub Paris, Sport Bar, Afterworks), 25 Rue Frédéric Sauton, 75005 Paris, France
description:
FRIDAY COUCHSURFING LANGUAGES in Paris, France at Jul 03, 2015,  7:30 PM (CEST). Hi everybody!

Whatever you're planning to do (have a drink, learn French, learn English, meet people…), just come to this nice pub, where you’re REALLY gonna enjoy the end of the week!

Everyone is welcome! If you’re in a good mood, come and share it! And if you’re feeling down, then come, and we will cheer you up!

Here is the Pub: “The Long Hop”, 25 Rue Frédéric Sauton, 75005 Paris (near the Latin Quarter, which is probably one of the most pleasant districts in Paris) 

 Bonjour à tous !

Quoi que vous souhaitiez faire (boire un verre, apprendre le français/l’anglais, rencontrer des gens…), venez dans ce bar très cool, où vous allez VRAIMENT profiter de la fin de cette semaine !

Tout le monde est bienvenu ! Si vous êtes de bonne humeur, venez et partagez-la ! Et si jamais vous n’avez pas le moral, venez quand même, nous vous redonnerons le sourire !

Voici le bar : “The Long Hop”, 25 Rue Frédéric Sauton, 75005 Paris (près du Quartier Latin, qui est sûrement l’un des quartiers les plus agréables de Paris) 

P.S: I will wear a beret, and I will be inside the bar, thus you should recognize me easily!

title: Bike critical mass of Velorution
start_at: Sat Jul 4 from  2:00 PM to  6:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 4 from  2:00 PM to  6:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Bike critical mass of Velorution in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 04, 2015,  2:00 PM (CEST). I attend to this event sometimes, we are usually around 200 bikes, it's pretty cool.

It's a peaceful demonstration to show that motor vehicles are not a fatality !

The meeting point is at Bastille (in front of the Opera where there will be plenty of bikes) at 2pm and then the attendees will ride together in a good mood.
Velibs, rollerskate and everything which move with your muscles is allowed into the group !

Information link (FR) :
http://velorution.org/

Facebook Page (FR) :
https://www.facebook.com/velorution.idf?ref=br_tf

Some rules :
- Please keep the Bus lanes free
- Please give way to the pedestrians during the trip
- No violence allowed on the motor vehicles
- Everyone is responsible for their own behavior and security (Neither I nor Velorution will take the responsibility of yourself in case of trouble).

Get ready to ring your bike bells and discover Paris in a new way.

I don't organise this event, so be sure to be on time (2PM).

Some tips :
- If you prefer to rent a normal bike instead of a Velib : http://www.gepetto-velos.com/
- Exact meeting point : https://www.google.fr/maps/@48.8526906,2.3698117,43m/data=!3m1!1e3


Video of the one which happened on last october :
https://vimeo.com/108000279

title: Pub Crawl in Bastille
description:
Pub Crawl in Bastille in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 04, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hey ladies and gents,

You ever try a real Parisian pub crawl? Now’s your chance to get your drink on with your favorite Parisian gal (or guy) in the historically badass Bastille.

For those who don’t sais, the Bastille is a well-known fortress where the French revolution took place. Over time, it’s become a hugely popular spot for pubs and partying. One of its most famous streets, rue de Lappe, is called the “thirsty street,” which pretty much speaks for itself….

Come and join me for an unforgettable night of pub-crawling the Bastille!

First, get your pass:

· €13 in advance gets you 4 shots, happy hours all night, and free entrance to a nightclub

· You can also choose to pay €15 at the door of the first bar.

Special offer to all the birthday folks: HALF-PRICE if your birthday has occurred or will occur within 5 days of the event.

The schedule is as follows:

1. Meet up: 8:00 PM - Meet us at 8.00 PM at Flag Café (5 bd Beaumarchais).

2. First bar - In the first bar, meet up with other folks from all around the world and get your first free shot.

3. Second bar: 9:20 PM - In the second bar, your fellow French pub-crawlers will join up, so you can practice your French (or body language if you don't speak French). You will get your 2nd shot at the end to keep you warm.

4. Third bar: 10:30 PM – This is the last bar before clubbing, a nice warm atmosphere before the night gets crazy. And, of course, a new shot to keep you going strong!

5. Clubbing: 11:40 PM - Let's all hit the club till the morning. Unlike Cinderella, make sure you stick around to get your final shot at midnight.

To sum up, the Parisian Pub Crawl Pass gives you access to: · Happy hour all night long for beers, soft drinks, cocktails, and hard liquor

· No extra charges for drinks after 1:00 AM

· 4 free shots (one in each pub)

· The chance to meet me (which is priceless :D)

(IDs will be requested to enter bars)

See you on saturday

Fred.

--------------------------------------------------------- 
¡Hola!

Descubre el pub Crawl de Paris.

¿Conoces el barrio de la Bastilla? Antiguamente era conocido por la plaza de la revolución francesa pero hoy en día es una plaza imprescindible de las noches parisinas, sobretodo la calle de la sed.

¡Os invito a pasar una noche de Crawling en este barrio!

Para saber más os invito a descubrir la planificación de la noche:

Para empezar, hay que comprar un « pass » en forma de pulsera por 15€ en el sitio (o por 13€ en preventa) que os permitirá de disfrutar de muchas ventajas durante toda la nocher 

A partir de las 20h15: nos reuniremos en el Flag café. Durante media hora empezaremos a conocernos tomando una cerveza, un coctel o lo que queráis. Así podremos charlar y reír un rato. Con la pulsera tendrás un chupito gratis.

21h30: iremos al segundo pub para encontrarnos con otro grupo (un grupo de franceses). Como en el primer bar, tendrás un chupito gratis. 22h30: iremos de camino el tercer pub donde nos quedará una hora para que le ambiente se ponga a tope. Con la pulsera, tendrás un chupito gratis. 23h30: Nos dejaremos llevar en el “dancefloor” durante toda la noche para los que aguanten. La entrada a la discoteca será gratuita y tendrás otro chupito gratis. La edad para este tipo de evento es más o menos entre 20 y 35 años.

Las ventajas del pubcrawl: 
- Happy hour toda la noche 
- 4 chupitos gratis 
- Entrada gratuita a la discoteca 
- Visita del barrio de la bastilla con franceses

¡Nos vemos el sábado! 
Fred

--------------------------------------------------------- 
Hello à tous,

A la découverte du pub crawl à Paris. Connaissez vous le quartier de Bastille, historiquement connu comme étant la place de la révolution française, aujourd'hui c'est une place incontournable de la nuit parisienne avec la rue de la soif. Je vous invite à vous joindre à moi pour une soirée de Crawling. Pour en savoir plus

title: Sunday Morning Outdoor Market
start_at: Sun Jul 5 from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 5 from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Sunday Morning Outdoor Market in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 05, 2015, 10:00 AM (CEST). May I suggest using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Be prepared to be tempted by the most beautiful and abundant fruits and vegetables, by wine-sellers, mushrooms, herbs, so much pastry and bread, fresh poultry and meats, and bright-eyed fishes! Don't be surprised to discover that you will want to buy it all!

____________ 
PARIS SUNDAY MORNING MARKET____________

SUNDAY/DIMANCHE ~ June 28 ~ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-outdoor-market-paris
SUNDAY/DIMANCHE ~ July 5 ~ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-outdoor-market-paris-2015-07-05
PARIS RENDEZ VOUS ~ July 19 - https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/sunday-morning-street-markets-prv-2015

Wake up on Sunday morning to join Parisians at the outdoor markets of "Ricard Lenoir" and "Place d'Aligre"

First - 
Richard Lenoir Sunday Morning Market 
A pleasure for Parisians and CS visitors to Paris 
Enjoy one of our city's fantastic weekly outdoor markets in the company of your Couchsurfing Friends!

From there, we shall enjoy a walk past the Place de la Bastille and on to the Place d'Aligre Market

_____________________________________________________________

Arrive hungry. There is a tempting variety of delicious street food available at the markets. You will want to taste some of it.

____________________________________________________________

Take Metro Line 5 to "Bréguet Sabin"

Meeting at the "Bréguet Sabin" Metro exit (Line 5) 
Leave the Metro by Sortie #1 to rue Saint-Sabin, the north stairway furthest from Place de la Bastille.

Detail Map where "X" marks the spot : www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Lenoir.jpg

Google Map to Place de la Bastille: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Place+de+la+Bastille/@48.852477,2.3677117,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x47e67201aca99229:0x231eb0c967e5eb10

___________________________________________________

* NOTE THE WEATHER: 
THERE IS ALWAYS A POSSIBILITY OF RAIN. 
If it is raining, we will still have this event. Rain is nothing unusual at a Paris public market. There is some protection under awnings and pavillons, but be warm and dry. 
In case of rain, BRING YOUR UMBRELLA/EMPORTEZ VOTRE PARAPLUIE.

title: Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday

end_at: Sun Jul 5 from  2:00 PM to  7:00 PM (CEST)
location: 18 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 05, 2015,  2:00 PM (CEST). Chaque dimanche, Jeux des buttes propose de jouer durant l'après-midi (14:00-19:00). Les jeux et les tables sont là, il ne manque plus que vous, et c'est participation libre : l'argent récolté sert à acheter de nouveaux jeux. Il y a toujours 10 à 20 personnes en dehors des couchsurfeurs, n'ayez pas peur qu'il n'y ait pas assez de monde.

Every sunday, Jeux des buttes propose to play during afternoon (14:00-19:00). Games and tables provided, just come. It's free, you give what you want, money will be used to buy new games. There is always 10 to 20 persons apart from CSers, so don't be afraid there won't be enough people. (Check facebook to be sure the meeting will happen.)

18-20 rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris 13.

(Restaurant "Au Temps des Cerises")

Métro Corvisart (M 6) / Place d'Italie (M 5, 6, 7).

https://www.facebook.com/JeuxDesButtes

title: Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub!
description:
Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub! in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 06, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello all travelers and Paris CSers,

The Quiz is our Monday weekly event even if playing the Quiz is optional. If you don't feel like playing, come and share a drink :)

Winners of the quiz get a bottle of vodka iwth juice and for the 2nd & 3rd place a round of shots!

If you are wondering who are the CSers ask to the bar staff, but you can just talk to someone, he or she'll usually be a CSer (at a certain time it is packed of CSers so just talk to someone randomly)

Even if the bar seems empty go inside and ask, at the end we're always 150 or more.

CS Paris has put together a weekly meet-up on Mondays nights for all it's Paris hosts, travelers, and their friends!

There will be cheap drinks, good food, and of course fabulous company.

Whether you're passing through Paris, just signed up to Couchsurfing, or are an old time CSer come join us for a night out on the town!

See you there!

WHEN ? EVERY monday from 8 pm The quiz starts at around 9 pm

WHERE ? The Lions Pub 153 rue du Chevaleret. 75013 Paris.

Metro 6 - Chevaleret or Metro 14, RER C - Bibliothèque François Mitterrand

HOW ? Stands ALL NIGHT - Kronenbourg Pint is 4€ - ALL other Pints 5€ - Mojito 5€ - the quizzmaster will get 2 free drinks and a Lions plate - Nachos plate : 5 € - Lions Plate (calamar, onion rings, chicken, french fries) : 10 €

PS: Since we are always a lot of people, remember to keep an eye on your stuff during the quiz!

location: L'atelier, Avenue Bernard Hirsch, Cergy, France
description:
Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi) in Cergy, Île-de-France, France at Jul 07, 2015,  6:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Nous vous proposons tous les mardis de participer à une réunion polyglot, de 18h30 à 21h00, au café "l'Atelier" (en face l'Essec et du parking de la Préfecture).
Nous nous retrouvons autour d'un verre, pour parler des langues qui ne nous sont pas maternelles.
Les langues pratiquées les plus souvent sont anglais, espagnol, allemand et français (langue étrangère), mais toutes les langues sont les bienvenues !

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hello,

We offer every Tuesday to attend a polyglot meeting, from 18:30 to 21:00 at the café "l'Atelier" (opposite ESSEC and parking of the Prefecture).
We meet for a drink, to speak foreign languages.
Usually, we speak English, Spanish, German and French, but all languages ​​are welcome!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hallo

wir bieten Euch an, dienstags am Polyglot-Treffen von 18:30 bis 21 Uhr im Café "L'Atelier" (gegenüber der Essec und dem Parkplatz der Präfektur) teilzunehmen.
Wir treffen uns dort auf ein Getränk um andere Sprachen zu sprechen als unsere Muttersprache. Die meist gesprochenen Sprachen sind Englisch, Spanisch, Deutsch und Französisch (als Fremdsprache), aber alle Sprachen sind willkommen!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
¡Hola a todos!

Los invitamos a participar en una reunión políglota, de 18h30 a 21h00, en el café L'Atélier (Frente a L'Essec y el parqueadero de la Prefectura).
Nosotros nos reunimos al calor de una bebida para conversar y practicar lenguas diferentes a la materna.
las lenguas más frecuentes en el grupo son el Inglés, el Español, el Alemán y el Francés (como lengua extranjera) ¡pero todas las idiomas son bienvenidas!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Cédric, Meike et Vincent
--- --- --- --- --- ---

Adresse :
Avenue Bernard Hirsch
95000 Cergy
-------------------------------
Activité présente sur :
Polyglot Club
http://www.polyglot-learn-language.com/meetings.php?post_id=1715

Facebook
http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#!/group.php?v=info&gid=288566448033

title: Cinema Club
description:
Cinema Club in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 07, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). Cinema Club is a loose collection of French, Ex-pats and travellers from Couchsurfing who head off to the cinema each week on a Tuesday night. We see a wide variety of film, from old black and white classics, to cult hits, or modern alternative films. We choose a different cinema each week and a different style, but one thing remains, we do this, and have done this, every week since June 2011. If you're a traveller don't worry, we always watch English language films, and if you're french, don't worry, they always have subtitles. After the film we usually hang around and take a beer at a bar or along the Seine if the weather is nice and talk about the film, cheese, the finer things in life or whatever might float our way. Come along and enjoy good cinema and good company. 

Details of this week's film will be online by the SUNDAY before the event. 

---Paris Cinéma Club---
So an Argentinian, an Australian and a Frenchman walk into a cinema… Every week night since June 2011, a different cinema, a different film, a cinematic experience and a beer. Viva la Paris.

title: El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol)
start_at: Tue Jul 7 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jul 7 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
location: 44 Boulevard de la Villette, París, Francia
description:
El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol) in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 07, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello everybody!!

We are happy to inform you that the nicest exchange of languages in Paris is coming back! Nothing about a table and people sitting speaking in an antinatural way, this is the concept:

Bring some food (For the first time you can bring chips or similar, experts users event cook at home :) We will share an aperitivo in the spanish way, drinking something, eating and making you feeling like you are part of our family. This is the best way to learn french or spanish, but if you want to speak english or even italian no problem, we are able to do it as well. Cheers and see you soon in El Aperitivo du Café Chéri (Facebook Group "El aperitivo de Belleville" for more events).

title: ☮☮☮ Tuesday Weekly Meeting #67 ☮☮☮
description:
☮☮☮ Tuesday Weekly Meeting #67 ☮☮☮ in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 07, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). The Event could be replaced by a CS Picnic if the weather is cool, news given 2/3 days in advance for the change of location (Depending of the Weather forecast)

❀❀❀ Hello Happy CouchSurfers ! ❀❀❀

◆ Get the latest details and pictures of the events here ◆

☞ https://www.facebook.com/groups/375285932624076/ ☜

❖ Join the event on CS if you are coming ❖

☞ https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/tuesday-weekly-meeting-64 ☜

✪✪✪ This is our alternative meeting for people like us who are looking for a chilled out weekly event in Paris, like you get in smaller cities ✪✪✪

☮ It's very much about the CouchSurfing spirit: being open to friendship and mutual trust, respect and exchange with people from other cultures and ways of life ☮

❀ Everyone sharing that spirit -solo travelers passing by, newbies and experienced CouchSurfers or locals wishing to meet new people- is welcome ! ❀

☆☆☆ So there will be no binge drinking☢, party rocking☣ or ♥girl picking♥ here ;-p ☆☆☆

۩۩۩ We found a bar with an international & traveler soul, the Belushi's, really near Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est train stations, so it will be easy for you to join us ! ۩۩۩

↓↓↓There you will get↓↓↓

① a warm welcome and a cool name tag from the awesome organizers ! ☺

② drink and food deals (special deals for CouchSurfers) ♨

③ lots of space & TVs

④ free WiFi to send friend requests to the nice people you'll meet !

⑤ available electrical plugs

⑥ cool conversations & socializing with open-minded people like yourself ! ☮

⑦ and free pool games ! ❽❽❽

We'll book a dedicated area with large tables where you can sit, relax and meet great people !

☆☆☆ So welcome aboard and come share your CouchSurfing stories and travel experiences with us ! And if you don't know yet what CouchSurfing is about or how it works, come and learn all about it through everyone's amazing experiences ! ☆☆☆

The limit is just a guide, you can still show up if it has reached the limit, keeping in mind that the goal is that it remains intimate so you can all get to know each other !

→→→ So join us here every Tuesday night ←←←

Belushi's

5 rue de Dunkerque

75010 Paris

Gare du Nord: M4/5 & RER B/D and suburban trains

Gare de l'Est: M4/5/7 and suburban trains

How to get there: http://goo.gl/maps/tw2Bd

The entrance: http://goo.gl/maps/nJvKX

✪✪✪ Go to the left end of the bar, walk up the stairs and look for the CS signs around the pool table! We'll be waiting for you and looking forward to meeting all of you ! ✪✪✪

✌✌✌ See you soon! ✌✌✌

Ethan Savoie & Jed

CS Paris

title: CS weekly meeting "russian-french"
start_at: Wed Jul 8 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Wed Jul 8 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
description:
CS weekly meeting "russian-french" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 08, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Vous savez que CHAQUE MERCREDI nous nous retrouvons vers 20 heures et pourquoi pas plus tôt aussi pour ceux qui veulent flâner !!! Si vous êtes russophone et voulez parler français ou inversement. Echanger des idées, partager des points de vue, parler de culture, demander des infos, de l'aide ou juste boire un verre. Rejoignez nous chaque mercredi au 9 rue des Boulangers près du métro Jussieu au Finnegans Wake.
Demandez au bar où l'on se trouve.
A bientôt !!! Франко-русская вечеринка в 2014 в Париже!!!
Сегодня, в среду , в 20 часов в Finneganns Wake.
Два зала в нашем распоряжении, музыка и танцы для всех, кто хочет расслабиться
Приносите игры, всё, чем желаете поделиться, книги, идеи и особенно ваше хорошее настроение!
Место: http://www.finneganswakeparis.com/
Адрес: улица des Boulangers, 9, напротив выхода из метро Jussieu.
Будем рады видеть новые лица и ваших друзей на каждой встрече. Белорусы, русские, украинцы и все, кто проездом в Париже, добро пожаловать !! До встречи.
Телефон для связи для новичков: +33 660 119 500
и ссылка на группу http://vk.com/club54479152

title: Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers'
start_at: Thu Jul 9 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 9 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers' in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 09, 2015,  6:00 PM (CEST). --*Museum "Arts & Metiers" :

Free: at 6pm till 9:30pm

*On the subway, the atmosphere is there … the station Arts & Métiers papered with copper and drilled by porthole, takes itself for the submarine Nautilus of Jules Verne.
In the religiously renewed abbey, the history techniques for the XVIth century follows seven domain: communication, construction, energy, instruments scientists, materials, mechanics, transport.
We can so understand everything big inventions and to dream in front of automatons and velocipedes, about the end of XVIIth century laboratory of Lavoisier or Clément Ader's plane...
-
*Dès le métro, l’ambiance est là… La station Arts & Métiers tapissée de cuivre et percée de hublot, se prend pour le sous-marin Nautilus de Jules Verne.
Dans l’abbaye religieusement rénovée, l’histoire des techniques depuis le XVIe siècle suit sept domaine: communication, construction, énergie, instruments scientifiques, matériaux, mécanique, transport.
On peut ainsi tout comprendre des grandes inventions et rêver devant les automates et les vélocipèdes, le laboratoire fin XVIIe de Lavoisier ou l’avion de Clément Ader, vieux d’un petit siècle de plus...

Address: 60, Rue Réaumur
Subway: Arts-et-Métiers (line 3 & 11)
---

-*Activitysurfing: Apérométro, Pubs/Parties/Clubs, Picnicsurfing (Picnics), Museums & Arts, Sightseeing, Photography, Concerts...etc

start_at: Thu Jul 9 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 9 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Conversation Table: Convertable in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 09, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). This group intends to bring together anglophones and francophones in order to create the opportunity for everyone to have conversations.  Anyone interested in languages and/or learning French or English is welcome. 
If you're the first to arrive, ask a table to the bar and tell them you're here for the Conversation table; be patient, people will arrive. 
 
 Le but de ce groupe est de rassembler les anglophones et francophones afin d'établir un commerce de langues: Toute personne intéressée par les langues et/ou qui souhaite perfectionner son anglais ou français est la bienvenue.
Si vous êtes le premier à arriver, demandez une table au bar et précisez que vous venez pour la Table de Conversation. Soyez patient, il y aura du monde.

title: Open mic & jam every thursday
location: Le Carre Saint Michel, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Open mic & jam every thursday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 09, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). I've been organizing those events weekly for the past 3 years with my talented singers and musicians friends that I have met on different concerts and TV shows in my 15 years in Paris, so you can hear some pretty cool artists and it's very nice to come and listen, or even play if you feel like it :) As I host a lot of couchsurfers and also post the event there and on Meetup, the atmosphere is quite international too with a pre-meeting with international travellers & expats from 8.30 to 9.30 before the music starts so people can get to know each other.

The drinks are pretty cheap compared to Paris prices, with happy hour prices all evening. And the bar is very central and easy to find, right by the métro exit in Saint-Michel. When the crowd is wild and we wanna keep playing, we actually often continue the jam by the river after 2 am.

The music usually starts around 9.30 but the Meeting starts at 8.30 so we can have time for drinks and get to know each other before I have to open the live session. You can find me easily (behind the sound counsol) if you arrive late though and I can point you to the Couchsurfers group.

The type of music depends on the performers who will show up. It's mostly pop, folk, rock, blues, soul, sometimes reggae, world music or rap. A little jazz sometimes, but it's mostly mainstream music.

All the sound system is in place and you can also borrow my electro acoustic guitar if you need, but it's still better to bring your own instrument if it can be plugged.

To ensure the quality of the performances for the audience, the first time performers should send me a link to one of their work or live videos, or you will have to play when the room is less crowded so I can know if I can release you in the wild jungle of a crowded audience later :)

▄▄▄ ★ INFO ★ ▄▄▄

Bar : Le Carré Saint michel Address : 4, Rue Suger, 75006 Metro-RER : Saint Michel (line 4 - RER B). The rue Suger is facing the métro exit "place Saint-André-des-Arts" so it's very easy to find. If you get off at any other exit, then you have to go right on the Saint-Michel fountain and you'll be on place Saint-André-des-Arts. From the place, 2 streets go right, the rue Suger is the second one.

▄▄▄ ★ PRICES ★ ▄▄▄

It's cover free but the bar owner won't be happy if you don't get at least one drink to help out the bar and the artists ;) The prices are cheaper than most places in Paris :

✪ Various shots : 3,5 € ✪ Glasses of wine : 4 € ✪ Beer Pints : 4.5 € ✪ Cocktails : 6 €

-----------------------------------

RDV à partir de 20h30 au Carré Saint-Michel pour l'Open Mic & Jam du jeudi ! Un niveau correct est requis pour chanter 2 à 3 chansons ou pour jammer avec les habitués du Carré pour garantir un show de qualité au public. Les musiciens et chanteurs habitués sont issus des meilleures rencontres musicales que j'ai pu faire lors de mes 14 ans de musique à Paris, dans divers concerts ou même quelques émissions de TV comme Nouvelle Star, The Voice, X-Factor ou Popstars donc il y a pas mal de voix étonnantes :)

title: Weekly language exchange @ TBD
start_at: Sat Jul 11 from  3:00 PM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 11 from  3:00 PM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Weekly language exchange @ TBD in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 11, 2015,  3:00 PM (CEST). All details on the Meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/overword/

"Dear language learners,

Thank you again for joining and to those who came at the previous meeting! Let's plan the next one straight away since we're all full of that learning energy ;)

Ready to practice languages in a motivating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone!

The meeting will be at <TBD>. Remember to take a look on www.overword.com for new materials. With your learning partners, you'll be able to talk and build exercises on them if you feel like it.

Hope to see you there. Cheers! Hien-Chanh"

title: Café-Anglais pour tous n°55
start_at: Sat Jul 11 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 11 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Café-Anglais pour tous n°55   in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 11, 2015,  4:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Le Café-Anglais consiste à discuter informellement in English
 autour d'un verre (and 50% in French si des natifs y participent).

Chacun arrive à l'heure qui l'arrange.

 *-* Tous les niveaux sont admis *-*

Nous constituons des groupes au hasard, et nous switchons de groupe au bout d'un certain temps afin de
pouvoir discuter avec un max de personnes.

It's more beneficial if people correct each other's mistake, identify desuetude words etc.

NB : afin de pouvoir continuer à nous rendre dans des bars qui se prêtent aux discussions en anglais, je vous remercie de bien vouloir passer au moins une commande ;-)

PS : dictionary is recommended :-)

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 Dear CouchSurfing members,

 I propose you to discuss informally, half in English and half in French if Natives.

 You can arrive when it suits you.

 *-* all levels are welcome *-*

 Groups are made randomly & we switch in order to discuss with a max of people.

 NB : to be able to continue to meet in proper bars, I thank you in advance to order at least one time ;-)

title: Brunch chez Damien
start_at: Sun Jul 12 from 11:30 AM to  3:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 12 from 11:30 AM to  3:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Brunch chez Damien in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 12, 2015, 11:30 AM (CEST). Citizens of the world in search of a moment of sharing in a friendly atmosphere, come join us !

Everyone bring something, whether it's a specialty of your country or your favorite bakery pastries, the main thing is to participate!

This event will take place at my apartment in nation district every two weeks. To have the exact address you just have to join and precise what you'll bring on the wall and then I will contact you with the location information. Don't trust the google maps.

5 reasons to join : 
- no need to bring cash, just bring food 
- Cup of tea, coffee, pain au chocolat will be served 
- getting to know new people in a friendly atmosphere (the music will not be so loud so no need to yell) 
- tasting new food elaborate by the participants 
- taking the time to discover new cultures

Of course if you have any question and suggestion just contact me.

title: Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday
start_at: Sun Jul 12 from  2:00 PM to  7:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 12 from  2:00 PM to  7:00 PM (CEST)
location: 18 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 12, 2015,  2:00 PM (CEST). Chaque dimanche, Jeux des buttes propose de jouer durant l'après-midi (14:00-19:00). Les jeux et les tables sont là, il ne manque plus que vous, et c'est participation libre : l'argent récolté sert à acheter de nouveaux jeux. Il y a toujours 10 à 20 personnes en dehors des couchsurfeurs, n'ayez pas peur qu'il n'y ait pas assez de monde.

Every sunday, Jeux des buttes propose to play during afternoon (14:00-19:00). Games and tables provided, just come. It's free, you give what you want, money will be used to buy new games. There is always 10 to 20 persons apart from CSers, so don't be afraid there won't be enough people. (Check facebook to be sure the meeting will happen.)

18-20 rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris 13.

(Restaurant "Au Temps des Cerises")

Métro Corvisart (M 6) / Place d'Italie (M 5, 6, 7).

https://www.facebook.com/JeuxDesButtes

Réunions de jeux de société : http://www.meetup.com/Paris-Jeux-public

title: Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub!
description:
Monday's Weekly Meeting at the Lions Pub! in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 13, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). 

Hello all travelers and Paris CSers,

The Quiz is our Monday weekly event even if playing the Quiz is optional. If you don't feel like playing, come and share a drink :)

Winners of the quiz get a bottle of vodka iwth juice and for the 2nd & 3rd place a round of shots!

If you are wondering who are the CSers ask to the bar staff, but you can just talk to someone, he or she'll usually be a CSer (at a certain time it is packed of CSers so just talk to someone randomly)

Even if the bar seems empty go inside and ask, at the end we're always 150 or more.

CS Paris has put together a weekly meet-up on Mondays nights for all it's Paris hosts, travelers, and their friends!

There will be cheap drinks, good food, and of course fabulous company.

Whether you're passing through Paris, just signed up to Couchsurfing, or are an old time CSer come join us for a night out on the town!

See you there!

WHEN ? EVERY monday from 8 pm The quiz starts at around 9 pm

WHERE ? The Lions Pub 153 rue du Chevaleret. 75013 Paris.

Metro 6 - Chevaleret or Metro 14, RER C - Bibliothèque François Mitterrand

HOW ? Stands ALL NIGHT - Kronenbourg Pint is 4€ - ALL other Pints 5€ - Mojito 5€ - the quizzmaster will get 2 free drinks and a Lions plate - Nachos plate : 5 € - Lions Plate (calamar, onion rings, chicken, french fries) : 10 €

PS: Since we are always a lot of people, remember to keep an eye on your stuff during the quiz!
