title: Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi)
start_at: Tue Jul 14 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jul 14 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
location: L'atelier, Avenue Bernard Hirsch, Cergy, France
description:
Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi) in Cergy, Île-de-France, France at Jul 14, 2015,  6:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Nous vous proposons tous les mardis de participer à une réunion polyglot, de 18h30 à 21h00, au café "l'Atelier" (en face l'Essec et du parking de la Préfecture).
Nous nous retrouvons autour d'un verre, pour parler des langues qui ne nous sont pas maternelles.
Les langues pratiquées les plus souvent sont anglais, espagnol, allemand et français (langue étrangère), mais toutes les langues sont les bienvenues !

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hello,

We offer every Tuesday to attend a polyglot meeting, from 18:30 to 21:00 at the café "l'Atelier" (opposite ESSEC and parking of the Prefecture).
We meet for a drink, to speak foreign languages.
Usually, we speak English, Spanish, German and French, but all languages ​​are welcome!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hallo

wir bieten Euch an, dienstags am Polyglot-Treffen von 18:30 bis 21 Uhr im Café "L'Atelier" (gegenüber der Essec und dem Parkplatz der Präfektur) teilzunehmen.
Wir treffen uns dort auf ein Getränk um andere Sprachen zu sprechen als unsere Muttersprache. Die meist gesprochenen Sprachen sind Englisch, Spanisch, Deutsch und Französisch (als Fremdsprache), aber alle Sprachen sind willkommen!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
¡Hola a todos!

Los invitamos a participar en una reunión políglota, de 18h30 a 21h00, en el café L'Atélier (Frente a L'Essec y el parqueadero de la Prefectura).
Nosotros nos reunimos al calor de una bebida para conversar y practicar lenguas diferentes a la materna.
las lenguas más frecuentes en el grupo son el Inglés, el Español, el Alemán y el Francés (como lengua extranjera) ¡pero todas las idiomas son bienvenidas!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Cédric, Meike et Vincent
--- --- --- --- --- ---

Adresse :
Avenue Bernard Hirsch
95000 Cergy
-------------------------------

Polyglot Club

title: Cinema Club
description:
Cinema Club in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 14, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). Cinema Club is a loose collection of French, Ex-pats and travellers from Couchsurfing who head off to the cinema each week on a Tuesday night. We see a wide variety of film, from old black and white classics, to cult hits, or modern alternative films. We choose a different cinema each week and a different style, but one thing remains, we do this, and have done this, every week since June 2011. If you're a traveller don't worry, we always watch English language films, and if you're french, don't worry, they always have subtitles. After the film we usually hang around and take a beer at a bar or along the Seine if the weather is nice and talk about the film, cheese, the finer things in life or whatever might float our way. Come along and enjoy good cinema and good company. 

Details of this week's film will be online by the SUNDAY before the event. 

---Paris Cinéma Club---
So an Argentinian, an Australian and a Frenchman walk into a cinema… Every week night since June 2011, a different cinema, a different film, a cinematic experience and a beer. Viva la Paris.

title: El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol)
start_at: Tue Jul 14 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jul 14 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
location: 44 Boulevard de la Villette, París, Francia
description:
El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol) in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 14, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello everybody!!

We are happy to inform you that the nicest exchange of languages in Paris is coming back! Nothing about a table and people sitting speaking in an antinatural way, this is the concept:

Bring some food (For the first time you can bring chips or similar, experts users event cook at home :) We will share an aperitivo in the spanish way, drinking something, eating and making you feeling like you are part of our family. This is the best way to learn french or spanish, but if you want to speak english or even italian no problem, we are able to do it as well. Cheers and see you soon in El Aperitivo du Café Chéri (Facebook Group "El aperitivo de Belleville" for more events).

end_at: Wed Jul 15 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
description:
CS weekly meeting "russian-french" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 15, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Vous savez que CHAQUE MERCREDI nous nous retrouvons vers 20 heures et pourquoi pas plus tôt aussi pour ceux qui veulent flâner !!! Si vous êtes russophone et voulez parler français ou inversement. Echanger des idées, partager des points de vue, parler de culture, demander des infos, de l'aide ou juste boire un verre. Rejoignez nous chaque mercredi au 9 rue des Boulangers près du métro Jussieu au Finnegans Wake.
Demandez au bar où l'on se trouve.
A bientôt !!! Франко-русская вечеринка в 2014 в Париже!!!
Сегодня, в среду , в 20 часов в Finneganns Wake.
Два зала в нашем распоряжении, музыка и танцы для всех, кто хочет расслабиться
Приносите игры, всё, чем желаете поделиться, книги, идеи и особенно ваше хорошее настроение!
Место: http://www.finneganswakeparis.com/
Адрес: улица des Boulangers, 9, напротив выхода из метро Jussieu.
Будем рады видеть новые лица и ваших друзей на каждой встрече. Белорусы, русские, украинцы и все, кто проездом в Париже, добро пожаловать !! До встречи.

BBQ + abandoned mine exploration - PRV 2015 in Île-de-France, France at Jul 16, 2015, 11:30 AM (CEST). Just before the official beginning of the Paris Rendez-Vous, let's go to a forest for a BBQ followed by some exploration inside a pretty nice limestone mine located more or less 45min from Paris.

What you need to bring:

- food for the BBQ (meat, vegetables, bread...)

- drinks (beers, wine...)

- comfortable shoes and clothes you don't care about (they're more than likely to get dirty)

title: Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers'
start_at: Thu Jul 16 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 16 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers' in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 16, 2015,  6:00 PM (CEST). --*Museum "Arts & Metiers" :

Free: at 6pm till 9:30pm

*On the subway, the atmosphere is there … the station Arts & Métiers papered with copper and drilled by porthole, takes itself for the submarine Nautilus of Jules Verne.
In the religiously renewed abbey, the history techniques for the XVIth century follows seven domain: communication, construction, energy, instruments scientists, materials, mechanics, transport.
We can so understand everything big inventions and to dream in front of automatons and velocipedes, about the end of XVIIth century laboratory of Lavoisier or Clément Ader's plane...
-
*Dès le métro, l’ambiance est là… La station Arts & Métiers tapissée de cuivre et percée de hublot, se prend pour le sous-marin Nautilus de Jules Verne.
Dans l’abbaye religieusement rénovée, l’histoire des techniques depuis le XVIe siècle suit sept domaine: communication, construction, énergie, instruments scientifiques, matériaux, mécanique, transport.
On peut ainsi tout comprendre des grandes inventions et rêver devant les automates et les vélocipèdes, le laboratoire fin XVIIe de Lavoisier ou l’avion de Clément Ader, vieux d’un petit siècle de plus...

Address: 60, Rue Réaumur
Subway: Arts-et-Métiers (line 3 & 11)
---

Anyone interested in languages and/or learning French or English is welcome.

Si vous êtes le premier à arriver, demandez une table au bar et précisez que vous venez pour la Table de Conversation. Soyez patient, il y aura du monde.

title: PRV 2015: Can Host / Need Host?
description:
PRV 2015: Can Host / Need Host? in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 16, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). For every large CS meeting, it can always be a bit complicated to find a host, especially in places like Paris, so why not create a "couch market"? Surfers should post under "Public comments" & hosts under "Attendee comments." 

► RULES:

1) Keep it simple: number of people & dates.

2) If hosts offer, read their profiles & write them a nice request, with links to your co-traveller(s) if it's for more than 1 person.

3) Delete your post once you've found a host/can't accept more surfers.

► This is only as a last resort, it's better to use the "Find hosts" tool and send personalized couchrequests first.

► Remember to join the main event & the sub-events: 
https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/paris-rendez-vous-2015-9th-edition-17-20-july

end_at: Thu Jul 16 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)
description:
An Evening in Paris - PRV 2015 in France at Jul 16, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Special Evening-Before Event

____________________________________________________

A WHIMSICAL & ROMANTIC WALK in PARIS

Especially for CouchSurfers on their first visit to Paris.

A leisurely strole through some of the most charming and romantic locations around old Paris.

We'll see the rue Mouffetard, Canal Saint Martin, Ile Saint Louis, and explore the quai along the Seine. We'll discover the Marais and enjoy some famous movie locations as we explore the "secret" places of Paris.

We can stop along the way for crepe, panini, sandwich grec, un cornet de glace, escargots, or pizza.

MEETING AT METRO LINE 7 - Station "Place Monge"

The Google Map: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Place+Monge/@48.84359,2.352279,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x47e671efac93284b:0x27a35291c0359894

title: Open mic & jam every thursday
location: Le Carre Saint Michel, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Open mic & jam every thursday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 16, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). I've been organizing those events weekly for the past 3 years with my talented singers and musicians friends that I have met on different concerts and TV shows in my 15 years in Paris, so you can hear some pretty cool artists and it's very nice to come and listen, or even play if you feel like it :) As I host a lot of couchsurfers and also post the event there and on Meetup, the atmosphere is quite international too with a pre-meeting with international travellers & expats from 8.30 to 9.30 before the music starts so people can get to know each other.

The drinks are pretty cheap compared to Paris prices, with happy hour prices all evening. And the bar is very central and easy to find, right by the métro exit in Saint-Michel. When the crowd is wild and we wanna keep playing, we actually often continue the jam by the river after 2 am.

The music usually starts around 9.30 but the Meeting starts at 8.30 so we can have time for drinks and get to know each other before I have to open the live session. You can find me easily (behind the sound counsol) if you arrive late though and I can point you to the Couchsurfers group.

The type of music depends on the performers who will show up. It's mostly pop, folk, rock, blues, soul, sometimes reggae, world music or rap. A little jazz sometimes, but it's mostly mainstream music.

All the sound system is in place and you can also borrow my electro acoustic guitar if you need, but it's still better to bring your own instrument if it can be plugged.

To ensure the quality of the performances for the audience, the first time performers should send me a link to one of their work or live videos, or you will have to play when the room is less crowded so I can know if I can release you in the wild jungle of a crowded audience later :)

▄▄▄ ★ INFO ★ ▄▄▄

Bar : Le Carré Saint michel Address : 4, Rue Suger, 75006 Metro-RER : Saint Michel (line 4 - RER B). The rue Suger is facing the métro exit "place Saint-André-des-Arts" so it's very easy to find. If you get off at any other exit, then you have to go right on the Saint-Michel fountain and you'll be on place Saint-André-des-Arts. From the place, 2 streets go right, the rue Suger is the second one.

▄▄▄ ★ PRICES ★ ▄▄▄

It's cover free but the bar owner won't be happy if you don't get at least one drink to help out the bar and the artists ;) The prices are cheaper than most places in Paris :

✪ Various shots : 3,5 € ✪ Glasses of wine : 4 € ✪ Beer Pints : 4.5 € ✪ Cocktails : 6 €

-----------------------------------

RDV à partir de 20h30 au Carré Saint-Michel pour l'Open Mic & Jam du jeudi ! Un niveau correct est requis pour chanter 2 à 3 chansons ou pour jammer avec les habitués du Carré pour garantir un show de qualité au public. Les musiciens et chanteurs habitués sont issus des meilleures rencontres musicales que j'ai pu faire lors de mes 14 ans de musique à Paris, dans divers concerts ou même quelques émissions de TV comme Nouvelle Star, The Voice, X-Factor ou Popstars donc il y a pas mal de voix étonnantes :)

title: WELCOME PICNIC - PRV 2015
location: Quai de la Tournelle, 75005 Paris, France
description:
WELCOME PICNIC - PRV 2015 in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 17, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). To start the Paris Rendez-Vous meeting, we invite you to the WELCOME PIC NIC. Bring some typical food from your country, county, district...and share with CSers from all over the world.

Our goal is to welcome you to Paris Rendez-Vous Weekend in one of the highlights of Paris!

Location: Quai de la Tournelle

The place is amazingly beautiful : a beautiful lawn near the Seine river with an amazing view of Notre Dame!

Please check the map to know where to find us! 
http://tinyurl.com/ormfhd8

RER B or C: Saint-Michel Notre-Dame
or
Metro 4: Saint-Michel
or
Metro 10: Maubert-Mutualité

-------------------------------------------------------------- 

We'll give you all the information you need for the 3 days meetings, maps, contact names, program...

--------------------------------------------------------------

Bring plastic bags or other things not to sit in the wet grass.

1. Meet the organizers of all the events for more details. 

2. Meet other participants to form teams for the activities!

Of course do not forget something to eat, something to drink... Bring BAGUETTE, WINE, CHEESE, and all manner of TREATS and GOODIES to eat and to share with others.

--------------------------------------------------------------

The best is to bring something special from your hometown to share with other CSers, it makes conversation always easier! 

--------------------------------------------------------------

See you there! 

The Paris Rendez-Vous Orga Team

title: GOURMET COOKING CONTEST - PRV 2015
start_at: Sat Jul 18 from 11:00 AM to  2:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 18 from 11:00 AM to  2:00 PM (CEST)
description:
GOURMET COOKING CONTEST - PRV 2015 in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 18, 2015, 11:00 AM (CEST). (May we suggest using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab)

_____________________________________________________________________________________

France is the land of delicious food and is known for its fabulous cuisine. Paris Rendez Vous brings you a unique opportunity to participate in this french past-time.

____________
The PARIS RENDEZ VOUS COOKING CONTEST ____________

                       SATURDAY/SAMEDI ~ Beginning at 11am/11h

This could be one of the most enjoyable and memorable parts of your visit to Paris.


~ Everyone attending Paris Rendez Vous is invited to attend. You can come as an entrant, to be a judge, or just to hang out and eat the food! 

You can enter the Cooking Contest in two categories: SAVORY and SWEET

Your dish can be hot or cold.

You may enter as many times as you like in either category or both.


_______________________________________________

Prepare your item in advance in your own kitchen or the kitchen of your CS Host, then bring it to the contest.

CS Hosts are encouraged to cook with your Surfer guests. An extra point will be given to CS Surfer/Host teams cooking together.

There will be time allowed for final preparations and presentation at the Contest before the judging begins.

Everyone who attends will have the pleasure of being a judge. Points will be counted for a favorite dish in each category, and a winner will be chosen in each category.

Take RER Line B to "Luxembourg" station.

Take Metro Line 12 to "Notre-Dame-des-Champs"

Detail Map where "X" marks the spot : www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Contest.jpg

Google Map to Location: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Luxembourg+Gardens/@48.8450387,2.3363712,15z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x47e671db36de687b:0x791dd61b089f98b


* NOTE: Some picnic plates, bowls, utensils and napkins will be provided, but be sure to bring any special requirements for serving your dish.

____________________________________________________________

Remember to join the main event & the sub-events: https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/paris-rendez-vous-2015-9th-edition-17-20-july

(Or https://www.facebook.com/events/798460406941746/?ref=4&source=4)

All events with links to Sign-up are listed at www.eneurope.net/CSParis/ParisRendezVous2015/

title: PARIS PASTRY TOUR 2015 - PRV 2015
start_at: Sat Jul 18 from  2:30 PM to  6:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 18 from  2:30 PM to  6:30 PM (CEST)
description:
PARIS PASTRY TOUR 2015 - PRV 2015 in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 18, 2015,  2:30 PM (CEST).  You ve heard Paris is the capital of patisseries and desserts but never understood why... Here s your chance to get a glimpse at what Paris has best to offer in terms of sugary sophistication. Sweet tooth beware.... You might never want to leave after that!

 Follow two self proclaimed fine food amateurs in a walk your palate will remember. We ll show you nine of the best pastry chefs in Paris, most of them being legends (Conticini) or stars (Michalak).

 We ll start after lunch, just in time for the dessert (preferably have a very light lunch) and go till tea time or a bit later (maybe till the apero to have a sip or two in order to finish off our livers).

 If the weather allows, we ll go by foot. If not, then subway my friends!

Each pastry is about 5€ and you can buy as many as you want in each pastry shop.   We suggest you share bites with your friends in order to discover the most flavours possible. Please dont bother coming without a budget as these places wont appreciate a horde coming in just to buy one cake (and therefore the number of attendees is limited).  

 A bottle of water or some tea might be a good investment in order to rinse that throat and make room for new saveurs.

 We ve done things well and  and made you a map, a list of the shops with their websites and suggestions of what to get there.  Exact route will be available as well as meeting point and phone numbers soon before the event.

https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=zbbVOIR8y4TI.kPOgfzotklhQ&usp=sharing

 Foddies ahoy!!

 Jo and Adrien.






PIERRE HERME
de Pierre Herme.
www.pierreherme.com

Les incontournables : 
L'Ispahan, l'Infiniment Vanille, le 2000 Feuilles.


LA PATISSERIE DES REVES 
de Philippe Conticini.
www.lapatisseriedesreves.com 

Les incontournables : 
Paris-Brest, Saint-Honoré, Grand Cru Vanille.  


DES GATEAUX ET DU PAIN
de Claire Damon.
http://www.desgateauxetdupain.com

Les incontournables : 
Le Kashmir, l'Absolu Citron et le Mont Blanc Cassis.


ARNAUD LARHER
de Araud Larher.
http://www.arnaudlarher.com

Les incontournables : Tarte Bahia, Tarte au Citron, Cheesecake aux Agrumes.


PAIN DE SUCRE
de Didier Mathray.
http://www.patisseriepaindesucre.com

Les incontournables : le Baobab, le Rosemary et le Millefeuille Vanille.


GATEAUX THOUMIEUX
de Jean-Francois Piege :
www.gateauxthoumieux.com 

Les incontournables : Le chou-chou praliné noisette, le sablé citron et l'éclair blanc-manger 


LENOTRE 
de Guy Krenzer.
www.lenotre.com 

Les incontournables : Millefeuille, Eclairs Croquembouche, Butterfly Vanille Cassis.


LE PLAZA ATHENEE
de Christophe Michalak.
http://www.christophemichalak.com

Les incontournables : Religieuse Caramel au Beurre de Sel, Millefeuille Caramélisé au Trois Vanilles.

title: Weekly language exchange @ TBD

end_at: Sat Jul 18 from  3:00 PM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Weekly language exchange @ TBD in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 18, 2015,  3:00 PM (CEST). All details on the Meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/overword/

"Dear language learners,

Thank you again for joining and to those who came at the previous meeting! Let's plan the next one straight away since we're all full of that learning energy ;)

Ready to practice languages in a motivating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone!

The meeting will be at <TBD>. Remember to take a look on www.overword.com for new materials. With your learning partners, you'll be able to talk and build exercises on them if you feel like it.

Hope to see you there. Cheers! Hien-Chanh"

Be prepared to be tempted by the most beautiful and abundant fruits and vegetables, by wine-sellers, mushrooms, herbs, so much pastry and bread, fresh poultry and meats, and bright-eyed fishes! Don't be surprised to discover that you will want to buy it all!

____________
The PARIS RENDEZ VOUS SUNDAY MORNING MARKETS ____________

                       SUNDAY/DIMANCHE ~ Beginning at 10am/10h

Wake up on Sunday morning to join Parisians at the outdoor markets of "Ricard Lenoir" and "Place d'Aligre"


First -
Richard Lenoir Sunday Morning Market
A pleasure for Parisians and CS visitors to Paris
Enjoy one of our city's fantastic weekly outdoor markets in the company of your Couchsurfing Friends!

From there, we shall enjoy a walk past the Place de la Bastille and on to the Place d'Aligre Market

_____________________________________________________________

Arrive hungry. There is a tempting variety of delicious street food available at the markets. You will want to taste some of it.

____________________________________________________________

Take Metro Line 5 to "Bréguet Sabin"

Meeting at the "Bréguet Sabin" Metro exit (Line 5)
Leave the Metro by Sortie #2 to rue Saint-Sabin, the north stairway furthest from Place de la Bastille.

___________________________________________________

THERE IS ALWAYS A POSSIBILITY OF RAIN.

title: 2000 years of Paris history thru sites - PRV 2015
start_at: Sun Jul 19 from 11:15 AM to  1:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 19 from 11:15 AM to  1:00 PM (CEST)
description:
2000 years of Paris history thru sites - PRV 2015 in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 19, 2015, 11:15 AM (CEST). Hello CSers and welcome to this event, part of our annual Paris Rendez-Vous!

We'll be covering about 2000 year of Paris history and seeing a lot of sites, mainly in the Latin Quarter.  

By the way, do you know why it's called Latin Quarter? (No, not because there are Latinos living there).

Did you know that Paris was called Lutetia by the Romans, in the days of the Roman Empire and we can still see sites from that period?

Did you know that in the middle of the 19th century downtown Paris was still a medieval area and it was Napoleon's idea to revamp it?

Did you know that around that same period water was scarce and expensive that an English Sir (Wallace) had fountains built and we can still see them today? (it's the green water fountain in the pic of the event).

We'll be covering a lot of stuff during this event and we'll finish it in this area where they have an open air accordion "steet ball", in a very quaint neighborhood. 

MEETING POINT:
Exit of métro "Cité" on line 4.   I'll be wearing an orange CS bandanna.  Please be on time: I don't want to be wearing that bandanna for a long time!

I'll send my number to participants via private message. 

See you on Sunday.

Remember to bring snacks & drinks as there are not many affordable shops in that area and we'll end up picnicking somewhere at some point.

title: 4ans autour du monde avec 0€
description:
4ans autour du monde avec 0€  in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 19, 2015,  3:00 PM (CEST). Après plus de 4 ans de voyage autour du monde en autostop, je suis de retour en France et je fais un tour de France pour faire des conferences dans des bars, associations... 
1/ Comment voyager avec peu d'argent (200€/mois autofinancé) 
2/ Comment construire la societé du futur ?
3/ Je jouerai ensuite un peu d'accordeon avec lequel j'ai voyagé (yann tiersen, Edith Piaf, Jacques Brel...)

J ai commencé a travailler comme ingenieur mais rapidement j ai compris que le bonheur humain et du monde ne résidait pas seulement dans la croissance économique, le pouvoir d'achat ou la technologique.

En voyageant, j ai donc cherché les bonnes idées dans differents pays grace aux nombreuses rencontres.

Afin de m'intégrer dans chaques pays et multiplier les rencontres, j'ai voyagé en stop, dormi chez l'habitant et gagné ma vie en excercant de nombreux petits boulots ou en aidant des ONGs. Je parlerai notamment du travail en Australie, du Tibet, du mode de vie des Papous, de la vie de musicien en Amérique du Sud, de mon travail comme prof de math au Sénégal...
La conférence dure entre 1H30 et 2H et elle est suivie de questions.

Entrée libre, participation au chapeau

-------------------

"Je recherche une association (étudiante, écologiste, humanitaire, religieuse...), un restaurant, un bar pour pouvoir accueillir l'évènement entre le 18 juillet et 30 aout. En m'invitant en semaine ou en weekend, vous médiatiser ainsi votre association ou votre restaurant.

Concernant le materiel, j'ai seulement besoin d'un vidéo-projecteur ou peut etre d'un micro si la salle est grande. Il y a 2 mois, il y avait eu 200 personnes à l'association Mission Bretonne
https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/581671"

l

adrien.laporte@hotmail.com 07 77 67 53 22

http://tourdumonde2010.free.fr/wordpresstdm/

title: Cinema Club - PRV 2015
start_at: Sun Jul 19 from  7:00 PM to 10:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 19 from  7:00 PM to 10:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Cinema Club - PRV 2015 in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 19, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). Cinema Club is being held on Sunday especially for inclusion in the Paris rendez-Vous. The Paris RDV is the largest CS event of the year, bringing together all communities of CS in Paris and we're proud to be a part of it again. We're going to watch in the latin quarter then all head to the sunday night activities after the film. For more information on Paris RDV see the event here https://www.couchsurfing.com/events/625280

Cinema Club is a loose collection of French, Ex-pats and travellers from Couchsurfing who head off to the cinema each week on a Tuesday night. We see a wide variety of film, from old black and white classics, to cult hits, or modern alternative films. We choose a different cinema each week and a different style, but one thing remains, we do this, and have done this, every week since June 2011. If you're a traveller don't worry, we always watch English language films, and if you're french, don't worry, they always have subtitles. After the film we usually hang around and take a beer at a bar or along the Seine if the weather is nice and talk about the film, cheese, the finer things in life or whatever might float our way. Come along and enjoy good cinema and good company. 

Details of this week's film will be online by the SUNDAY before the event. 

---Paris Cinéma Club---
So an Argentinian, an Australian and a Frenchman walk into a cinema… Every week night since June 2011, a different cinema, a different film, a cinematic experience and a beer. Viva la Paris.

title: Big Monday Quiz-Election of King and Queen of PRV!
description:
Big Monday Quiz-Election of King and Queen of PRV! in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 20, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Every Monday, Paris CS'ers gather at the Lions Pub for drinks, chat, and a music/trivia quiz. This Monday will be no different... well, other than instead of the usual 80 we'll probably have 180 people! And we promise, the quiz will be like no other before it! Winners get free drinks and free shots for the 2nd and 3rd place!

This year after the quiz, we will also have the election of the King and the Queen of the Paris Rendez-Vous 2015!

- If you want to participate and you're a man, come in a woman's costume! - If you want to participate and you're a woman, come in a man's costume!

We will choose the winners by public applause! The elected King and Queen will win a bottle of champagne (and some surprise gifts) and the rest of participants will win free shots!

Since we cannot have 100 candidates because of the time, we will limit them to 5 of each category so if you REALLY want to participate (meaning that you will come with the costume), send me a message here: https://www.couchsurfing.com/people/monoter

Come and celebrate the end of another great Paris Rendez Vous!

See you there!

WHEN ?
Monday from 8 pm
The quiz starts at around 9 pm

WHERE ? 
The Lions Pub 153 rue du Chevaleret. 75013 Paris.

Metro 6 - Chevaleret or Metro 14, RER C - Bibliothèque François Mitterrand

HOW ? 
Stands ALL NIGHT 
- Kronenbourg Pint is 4€ 
- ALL other Pints 5€ 
- Mojito 5€ 
- Nachos plate : 5 € 
- Lions Plate (calamar, onion rings, chicken, french fries) : 10 €

PS: Since we are always a lot of people, remember to keep an eye on your stuff during the quiz!

This day trip to Paul Monet's Giverny begins with a train journey to the Normandy town of Vernon. After departing the train, we'll have a leisurely stroll through the town, get some picnic supplies, and stroll along the lovely country lanes along the Seine to the village of Giverny.

title: Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi)
start_at: Tue Jul 21 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Tue Jul 21 from  6:30 PM to  9:00 PM (CEST)
location: L'atelier, Avenue Bernard Hirsch, Cergy, France
description:
Polyglot Cergy (tous les mardi) in Cergy, Île-de-France, France at Jul 21, 2015,  6:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Nous vous proposons tous les mardis de participer à une réunion polyglot, de 18h30 à 21h00, au café "l'Atelier" (en face l'Essec et du parking de la Préfecture).
Nous nous retrouvons autour d'un verre, pour parler des langues qui ne nous sont pas maternelles.
Les langues pratiquées les plus souvent sont anglais, espagnol, allemand et français (langue étrangère), mais toutes les langues sont les bienvenues !

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hello,

We offer every Tuesday to attend a polyglot meeting, from 18:30 to 21:00 at the café "l'Atelier" (opposite ESSEC and parking of the Prefecture).
We meet for a drink, to speak foreign languages.
Usually, we speak English, Spanish, German and French, but all languages ​​are welcome!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Hallo

wir bieten Euch an, dienstags am Polyglot-Treffen von 18:30 bis 21 Uhr im Café "L'Atelier" (gegenüber der Essec und dem Parkplatz der Präfektur) teilzunehmen.
Wir treffen uns dort auf ein Getränk um andere Sprachen zu sprechen als unsere Muttersprache. Die meist gesprochenen Sprachen sind Englisch, Spanisch, Deutsch und Französisch (als Fremdsprache), aber alle Sprachen sind willkommen!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
¡Hola a todos!

Los invitamos a participar en una reunión políglota, de 18h30 a 21h00, en el café L'Atélier (Frente a L'Essec y el parqueadero de la Prefectura).
Nosotros nos reunimos al calor de una bebida para conversar y practicar lenguas diferentes a la materna.
las lenguas más frecuentes en el grupo son el Inglés, el Español, el Alemán y el Francés (como lengua extranjera) ¡pero todas las idiomas son bienvenidas!

--- --- --- --- --- ---
Cédric, Meike et Vincent
--- --- --- --- --- ---

Adresse :
Avenue Bernard Hirsch
95000 Cergy

title: El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol)

end_at: Tue Jul 21 from  8:00 PM to 11:30 PM (CEST)

description:
El aperitivo de Belleville (Exchange franco-espagnol) in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 21, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Hello everybody!!

We are happy to inform you that the nicest exchange of languages in Paris is coming back! Nothing about a table and people sitting speaking in an antinatural way, this is the concept:

Bring some food (For the first time you can bring chips or similar, experts users event cook at home :) We will share an aperitivo in the spanish way, drinking something, eating and making you feeling like you are part of our family. This is the best way to learn french or spanish, but if you want to speak english or even italian no problem, we are able to do it as well. Cheers and see you soon in El Aperitivo du Café Chéri (Facebook Group "El aperitivo de Belleville" for more events).

title: Tonight I'm in Duplex
description:

title: CS weekly meeting "russian-french"
start_at: Wed Jul 22 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Wed Jul 22 from  8:00 PM to 11:00 PM (CEST)
description:
CS weekly meeting "russian-french" in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 22, 2015,  8:00 PM (CEST). Vous savez que CHAQUE MERCREDI nous nous retrouvons vers 20 heures et pourquoi pas plus tôt aussi pour ceux qui veulent flâner !!! Si vous êtes russophone et voulez parler français ou inversement. Echanger des idées, partager des points de vue, parler de culture, demander des infos, de l'aide ou juste boire un verre. Rejoignez nous chaque mercredi au 9 rue des Boulangers près du métro Jussieu au Finnegans Wake.
Demandez au bar où l'on se trouve.
A bientôt !!! Франко-русская вечеринка в 2014 в Париже!!!
Сегодня, в среду , в 20 часов в Finneganns Wake.
Два зала в нашем распоряжении, музыка и танцы для всех, кто хочет расслабиться
Приносите игры, всё, чем желаете поделиться, книги, идеи и особенно ваше хорошее настроение!
Место: http://www.finneganswakeparis.com/
Адрес: улица des Boulangers, 9, напротив выхода из метро Jussieu.
Будем рады видеть новые лица и ваших друзей на каждой встрече. Белорусы, русские, украинцы и все, кто проездом в Париже, добро пожаловать !! До встречи.
Телефон для связи для новичков: +33 660 119 500
и ссылка на группу http://vk.com/club54479152

title: Marais Free Tour
description:
Marais Free Tour in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 23, 2015,  8:00 AM (CEST). You cant come to Paris without visiting le Marais, they say. Seen as the most trendy area to live in the world Marais hides houses from the 17th century and the charming Jewish area.

title: Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers'
start_at: Thu Jul 23 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 23 from  6:00 PM to  9:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Free: Museum 'Arts & Metiers' in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 23, 2015,  6:00 PM (CEST). --*Museum "Arts & Metiers" :

Free: at 6pm till 9:30pm

*On the subway, the atmosphere is there … the station Arts & Métiers papered with copper and drilled by porthole, takes itself for the submarine Nautilus of Jules Verne.
In the religiously renewed abbey, the history techniques for the XVIth century follows seven domain: communication, construction, energy, instruments scientists, materials, mechanics, transport.
We can so understand everything big inventions and to dream in front of automatons and velocipedes, about the end of XVIIth century laboratory of Lavoisier or Clément Ader's plane...
-
*Dès le métro, l’ambiance est là… La station Arts & Métiers tapissée de cuivre et percée de hublot, se prend pour le sous-marin Nautilus de Jules Verne.
Dans l’abbaye religieusement rénovée, l’histoire des techniques depuis le XVIe siècle suit sept domaine: communication, construction, énergie, instruments scientifiques, matériaux, mécanique, transport.
On peut ainsi tout comprendre des grandes inventions et rêver devant les automates et les vélocipèdes, le laboratoire fin XVIIe de Lavoisier ou l’avion de Clément Ader, vieux d’un petit siècle de plus...

Address: 60, Rue Réaumur
Subway: Arts-et-Métiers (line 3 & 11)
---

title: Conversation Table: Convertable
start_at: Thu Jul 23 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
end_at: Thu Jul 23 from  7:00 PM to 10:30 PM (CEST)
description:
Conversation Table: Convertable in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 23, 2015,  7:00 PM (CEST). This group intends to bring together anglophones and francophones in order to create the opportunity for everyone to have conversations.  Anyone interested in languages and/or learning French or English is welcome. 
If you're the first to arrive, ask a table to the bar and tell them you're here for the Conversation table; be patient, people will arrive. 
 
 Le but de ce groupe est de rassembler les anglophones et francophones afin d'établir un commerce de langues: Toute personne intéressée par les langues et/ou qui souhaite perfectionner son anglais ou français est la bienvenue.
Si vous êtes le premier à arriver, demandez une table au bar et précisez que vous venez pour la Table de Conversation. Soyez patient, il y aura du monde.

title: Open mic & jam every thursday
location: Le Carre Saint Michel, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Open mic & jam every thursday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 23, 2015,  8:30 PM (CEST). I've been organizing those events weekly for the past 3 years with my talented singers and musicians friends that I have met on different concerts and TV shows in my 15 years in Paris, so you can hear some pretty cool artists and it's very nice to come and listen, or even play if you feel like it :) As I host a lot of couchsurfers and also post the event there and on Meetup, the atmosphere is quite international too with a pre-meeting with international travellers & expats from 8.30 to 9.30 before the music starts so people can get to know each other.

The drinks are pretty cheap compared to Paris prices, with happy hour prices all evening. And the bar is very central and easy to find, right by the métro exit in Saint-Michel. When the crowd is wild and we wanna keep playing, we actually often continue the jam by the river after 2 am.

The music usually starts around 9.30 but the Meeting starts at 8.30 so we can have time for drinks and get to know each other before I have to open the live session. You can find me easily (behind the sound counsol) if you arrive late though and I can point you to the Couchsurfers group.

The type of music depends on the performers who will show up. It's mostly pop, folk, rock, blues, soul, sometimes reggae, world music or rap. A little jazz sometimes, but it's mostly mainstream music.

All the sound system is in place and you can also borrow my electro acoustic guitar if you need, but it's still better to bring your own instrument if it can be plugged.

To ensure the quality of the performances for the audience, the first time performers should send me a link to one of their work or live videos, or you will have to play when the room is less crowded so I can know if I can release you in the wild jungle of a crowded audience later :)

▄▄▄ ★ INFO ★ ▄▄▄

Bar : Le Carré Saint michel Address : 4, Rue Suger, 75006 Metro-RER : Saint Michel (line 4 - RER B). The rue Suger is facing the métro exit "place Saint-André-des-Arts" so it's very easy to find. If you get off at any other exit, then you have to go right on the Saint-Michel fountain and you'll be on place Saint-André-des-Arts. From the place, 2 streets go right, the rue Suger is the second one.

▄▄▄ ★ PRICES ★ ▄▄▄

It's cover free but the bar owner won't be happy if you don't get at least one drink to help out the bar and the artists ;) The prices are cheaper than most places in Paris :

✪ Various shots : 3,5 € ✪ Glasses of wine : 4 € ✪ Beer Pints : 4.5 € ✪ Cocktails : 6 €

-----------------------------------

RDV à partir de 20h30 au Carré Saint-Michel pour l'Open Mic & Jam du jeudi ! Un niveau correct est requis pour chanter 2 à 3 chansons ou pour jammer avec les habitués du Carré pour garantir un show de qualité au public. Les musiciens et chanteurs habitués sont issus des meilleures rencontres musicales que j'ai pu faire lors de mes 14 ans de musique à Paris, dans divers concerts ou même quelques émissions de TV comme Nouvelle Star, The Voice, X-Factor ou Popstars donc il y a pas mal de voix étonnantes :)

title: Weekly language exchange @ Indiana Café
start_at: Sat Jul 25 from  3:00 PM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 25 from  3:00 PM to  5:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Weekly language exchange @ Indiana Café in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 25, 2015,  3:00 PM (CEST). All details on the Meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/overword/

"Dear language learners,

Thank you again for joining and to those who came at the previous meeting! Let's plan the next one straight away since we're all full of that learning energy ;)

Ready to practice languages in a motivating way? Let's gather, meet, talk, listen, discuss, debate, smile, laugh, etc. No matter your current level, your shyness, your look or personality, we judge no one and accept everyone!

The meeting will be at "Indiana Café", 129 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France (metro: Gare de l'Est, ligne 4, 5, 7). We'll be next to the pool table ,feel free to ask the kind waiters if you can't find us. Remember to take a look on www.overword.com for new materials. With your learning partners, you'll be able to talk and build exercises on them if you feel like it.

Hope to see you there. Cheers! Hien-Chanh"

title: Café-Anglais pour tous n°55
start_at: Sat Jul 25 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sat Jul 25 from  4:30 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
description:
Café-Anglais pour tous n°55   in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 25, 2015,  4:30 PM (CEST). Bonjour,

Le Café-Anglais consiste à discuter informellement in English
 autour d'un verre (and 50% in French si des natifs y participent).

Chacun arrive à l'heure qui l'arrange.

 *-* Tous les niveaux sont admis *-*

Nous constituons des groupes au hasard, et nous switchons de groupe au bout d'un certain temps afin de
pouvoir discuter avec un max de personnes.

It's more beneficial if people correct each other's mistake, identify desuetude words etc.

NB : afin de pouvoir continuer à nous rendre dans des bars qui se prêtent aux discussions en anglais, je vous remercie de bien vouloir passer au moins une commande ;-)

PS : dictionary is recommended :-)

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 Dear CouchSurfing members,

 I propose you to discuss informally, half in English and half in French if Natives.

 You can arrive when it suits you.

 *-* all levels are welcome *-*

 Groups are made randomly & we switch in order to discuss with a max of people.

 NB : to be able to continue to meet in proper bars, I thank you in advance to order at least one time ;-)

title: PICNIC: 6th Anniversary "Picnic du Jour"
start_at: Sun Jul 26 from 12:00 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 26 from 12:00 PM to  8:00 PM (CEST)
description:
PICNIC: 6th Anniversary "Picnic du Jour" in Sceaux, Île-de-France, France at Jul 26, 2015, 12:00 PM (CEST). (I recommend using the links with a right mouse button - opening in a new tab)

_____________________________________________________________________________________


OUR BIG ANNUAL 'Picnic du Jour' SPECIAL ANNIVERSARY EVENT

On SUNDAY/DIMANCHE - July 26, 2015 we celebrate...


The SIXTH ANNIVERSARY "Paris Picnic du Jour" PICNIC!

at le Chateau et Parc de Sceaux

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Begins env. 12h midi/noon. Come at any time during the day.

le Plan/the Map with the "X":
http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/Sceaux.jpg

The Google Map for Parc de Sceaux: https://www.google.com/maps/@48.7698374,2.2962706,15z

>>> http://www.eneurope.net/CSParis/Picnic/PicnicColors.jpg <<< You will find us if you look for the "Picnic du Jour" tri-color blanket


The "PICNIC du JOUR" was invented on July 21, 2009.
Following the Paris Rendez-Vous 2009 weekend, the Picnic du Jour was born. That was on a Tuesday.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Le «Pique-nique du jour» a été inventé il ya trois ans le 21 Juillet 2009.
Après le Paris Rendez-vous 2009 week-end, le pique-nique du Jour est né.
C'était un mardi.

Bring VERRES en PLASTIQUE, WINE & Drinks, BAGUETTE, Serviettes, Apportez un tire-bouchon, and anything else that you want to eat and share. Be warm. Bring your music. (Carry your parapluie just in case if you think it will be required.)

Bring CAKE! It is a Birthday Party, after all!


**************

Directions...

Take RER B to:
Gare "Parc de Sceaux",
"Bourg-la-Reine", or
"Croix-de-Bercy"

All stations serve the Parc de Sceaux.

Not all trains stop at all stations. Use any station that your train stops at.

--------------------------------------

Travel to Sceaux by train with the first group at 11h30
A group traveling to Sceaux together on the RER.
If you want to join us in a group going to Sceaux together, we will meet at 11:30am/11h30
at the RER "B" Station at Denfert-Rochereau
(Meet on the train platform)
Sorry, we will not wait for late arrivals. We must catch the train! Please, just follow at your convenient departure time.

Parc de Sceaux is in transit Zone 3
(about 4 € round-trip)



In case of RAIN...
It is all about water. Is the ground too wet for a picnic?
le PICNIC du JOUR WILL BEGIN ONE HOUR AFTER THE SUN RETURNS and THE GROUND IS DRY
If the place is wet or damp, the picnic may be cancelled.


"le Picnic du Jour Paris" sub-group

If you want to receive Instant Updates of the "Picnic du Jour" but not all of the posts from the Paris group, you can join the new sub-group for the updates. Just join the group, go to "My Group Settings", and set your messaging preference to "Instant Updates". The Picnic is posted each day to the new sub-group and the Paris group. 

Here's the link: https://www.couchsurfing.com/groups/le-paris-picnic-du-jour

title: Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday
start_at: Sun Jul 26 from  2:00 PM to  7:00 PM (CEST)
end_at: Sun Jul 26 from  2:00 PM to  7:00 PM (CEST)
location: 18 Rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris, Île-de-France, France
description:
Boardgames Jeux des Buttes, Place d'Italie, sunday in Paris, Île-de-France, France at Jul 26, 2015,  2:00 PM (CEST). Chaque dimanche, Jeux des buttes propose de jouer durant l'après-midi (14:00-19:00). Les jeux et les tables sont là, il ne manque plus que vous, et c'est participation libre : l'argent récolté sert à acheter de nouveaux jeux. Il y a toujours 10 à 20 personnes en dehors des couchsurfeurs, n'ayez pas peur qu'il n'y ait pas assez de monde.

Every sunday, Jeux des buttes propose to play during afternoon (14:00-19:00). Games and tables provided, just come. It's free, you give what you want, money will be used to buy new games. There is always 10 to 20 persons apart from CSers, so don't be afraid there won't be enough people. (Check facebook to be sure the meeting will happen.)

18-20 rue de la Butte aux Cailles, Paris 13.

(Restaurant "Au Temps des Cerises")

Métro Corvisart (M 6) / Place d'Italie (M 5, 6, 7).

https://www.facebook.com/JeuxDesButtes

Réunions de jeux de société : http://www.meetup.com/Paris-Jeux-public
